Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
What we do

msg global solutions leverages cutting-edge technologies, including AI, to solve business challenges. We partner with industry leaders like SAP and AWS to deliver enterprise solutions to Fortune 500 companies, transforming data into valuable insights.

Our solutions reshape industries such as finance, insurance, and manufacturing, specializing in:


Advanced analytics and AI technologies
Industry-specific technologies and IoT integration
Data-driven operational excellence


By partnering with us, organizations can transform their business models, uncover new revenue streams, and achieve operational excellence. As part of the msg group, we combine specialized agility with global IT resources to shape the future of business.

What you will do

You will work closely with our team to build end-to-end data driven products that solve complex real-word problems and drive business value for our clients.

Key responsibilities include:


Machine Learning Model Development: Design, develop and implement state-of-the-art machine learning models to solve complex business problems.
Problem Discovery and Exploration: Lead the discovery of business pain points, the formulation the problem statement and the exploration of solutions feasibility.
Collaboration: Work with the rest of the team and business stakeholders to integrate models and solution in production systems.
Code Excellence: Develop high-quality, efficient, and reusable code for data science projects.
Innovation and Experimentation: Drive innovation by continuously exploring and implementing the latest advancement in AI, machine learning and software development.
Mentorship: Provide guidance and mentorship to junior data scientists contributing, at the same time, to the overall growth of the data science team.


What we are looking for


Bachelor’s, Master’s, or PhD in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics or related fields.
5+ years of experience in data science, machine learning, and software development.
Strong proficiency in Python programming language. Knowledge of additional programming languages such as Java, C++, or similar is considered a plus.
Experience with machine learning frameworks (e.g., PyTorch, TensorFlow, Scikit-learn).
Proficiency in software development best practices, including version control (Git), testing. Experience in CI/CD pipelines considered a plus.
Strong business acumen in translating business problems into technical solutions.
Solid experience with relational (SQL) and NoSQL databases. Big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark) considered a plus.
Proven experience in designing and deploying machine learning models at scale.
Strong understanding of cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure) and containerization (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).
Professional proficiency in English.


Even if you don’t meet all of the criteria mentioned above, we would still love to hear from you! We are looking for a variety of roles, and if you are intrigued by us, we might find a good place for you in our growing team.

What we offer


A place where individuals are equally valued and where diversity and cultural differences are cherished.
A global team of highly respected experts where you can make a difference.
Competitive salaries and a broad range of benefits, some of which are highlighted below.
Working on AI-driven solutions that balance innovation and ethical responsibility, contributing to the future of business and technology.


Benefits


Health Insurance: We pay special attention to your healthcare and provide integrative medical insurance.
Welfare Plan: Thanks to our Company Welfare Plan, we provide you the possibility to tailor your benefits.
Job for Friends: Get your friends on board through our employee referral program and we will reward you.
Team Events: We celebrate our success with team-building activities organized throughout the year.
Flexible Working: We offer flexible work schedules, including flexible start and end times as well as remote and/or hybrid work.
Anniversary Milestones: We celebrate your work anniversaries by rewarding your loyalty and dedication.
Meal Vouchers: We provide meal vouchers that can be used in restaurants and supermarkets.
Training and Development: We provide a broad training portfolio for personal and professional growth, including unlimited access to course platform to all our employees.

Title: ML Engineer
Description:
Department

At Sappi, our Digital Transformation team thrives on tackling business challenges by harnessing the power of analytics, AI, and user-centric design. Driven by a passionate group of data and analytics experts, we optimise processes, uncover valuable insights, and empower proactive decision-making to drive success. Join us as we innovate and transform the future

Role and Responsibilities

In this role you will report to the Head of Data Analytics (based in Brussels).

You will be responsible for:

Collaborating with various teams to analyze key business problems and develop innovative ML solutions, continuously delivering valuable output.
Designing and implementing scalable machine learning (ML) and Artificial Intelligence (AI) solutions into daily operations.
Establishing testing, monitoring and continuous improvement of ML processes.
Making relevant, detailed, well-structured data available for analytics
Applying data science best practices focusing on data preprocessing, feature engineering and model evaluation. Enable rapid prototyping and evaluation.

Required Qualifications

Experience developing and optimizing scalable machine learning solutions on cloud platforms (e.g., GCP, Azure, AWS).
Strong expertise in ML operations and coding with Python; knowledge of SQL is a plus.
Excellent collaboration and communication skills, adaptable to both technical and business audiences.
Intellectual curiosity and a degree in a relevant field (e.g., computer science, statistics, mathematics, engineering).
Fluent in English.

Traveling:

It is expected to have some traveling (up to 10%) to the locations of group.

What we offer:

An excellent opportunity to work, learn & grow with us. With our culture of learning & development, you can access thousands of online trainings
A multi-cultural & international environment to share and collaborate with colleagues from more than 68 nationalities in 31 locations globally.
A unique opportunity to join a global wood fibre solution company. We are constantly innovating toward a circular economy working to achieve our sustainability goals & reduce our carbon foot print.
Friendly atmosphere and team-work oriented culture
Work-life balance
Training opportunities

All qualified applicants will be considered for employment, regardless of their race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, pregnancy, neurodiversity, disability, or any other aspect that makes them unique.

Show more
HTML:
Department

At Sappi, our Digital Transformation team thrives on tackling business challenges by harnessing the power of analytics, AI, and user-centric design. Driven by a passionate group of data and analytics experts, we optimise processes, uncover valuable insights, and empower proactive decision-making to drive success. Join us as we innovate and transform the future

Role and Responsibilities

In this role you will report to the Head of Data Analytics (based in Brussels).

You will be responsible for:

  • Collaborating with various teams to analyze key business problems and develop innovative ML solutions, continuously delivering valuable output.
  • Designing and implementing scalable machine learning (ML) and Artificial Intelligence (AI) solutions into daily operations.
  • Establishing testing, monitoring and continuous improvement of ML processes.
  • Making relevant, detailed, well-structured data available for analytics
  • Applying data science best practices focusing on data preprocessing, feature engineering and model evaluation. Enable rapid prototyping and evaluation.

Required Qualifications

  • Experience developing and optimizing scalable machine learning solutions on cloud platforms (e.g., GCP, Azure, AWS).
  • Strong expertise in ML operations and coding with Python; knowledge of SQL is a plus.
  • Excellent collaboration and communication skills, adaptable to both technical and business audiences.
  • Intellectual curiosity and a degree in a relevant field (e.g., computer science, statistics, mathematics, engineering).
  • Fluent in English.

Traveling:

It is expected to have some traveling (up to 10%) to the locations of group.

What we offer:

  • An excellent opportunity to work, learn & grow with us. With our culture of learning & development, you can access thousands of online trainings
  • A multi-cultural & international environment to share and collaborate with colleagues from more than 68 nationalities in 31 locations globally.
  • A unique opportunity to join a global wood fibre solution company. We are constantly innovating toward a circular economy working to achieve our sustainability goals & reduce our carbon foot print.
  • Friendly atmosphere and team-work oriented culture
  • Work-life balance
  • Training opportunities

All qualified applicants will be considered for employment, regardless of their race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, pregnancy, neurodiversity, disability, or any other aspect that makes them unique.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Job Location

Brussels

Job Description

Do you want to belong to one of the most advanced Data Science groups in the industry, developing advanced AI, ML and optimization algorithms, and applying Operations Research techniques?

Do you have passion for technology and desire to learn and grow continuously?

A career in IT Data Science & Analytics at P&G will build your Data Science and Analytics skills, develop your ability to influence and think strategically and will provide you a breadth of experience across multiple internal businesses and type of work (whether you do Analytics for Marketing, Sales, Supply Chain).

As a Data Scientist for the Supply Chain you will belong to an award-winning Analytics / Operations Research community that is global in scope, and operates across P&G’s supply chains.

Find out more about IT at P&G at www.youtube.com/watch?v=1ial3aeA9SE .

Your Contribution To P&g’s Success

Our Data Scientists in IT Data & Analytics at P&G are:


Passionate about Analytics: the ability to mine terabytes of data, develop models and algorithms to derive actionable insights, and then translate those insights into business is important in our work. In this role you will provide consulting services to P&G business units in Europe, India, Middle East and Africa; you will use mathematical modelling, decision analysis and simulation to provide business insights to various aspects of the supply network (supply chain design, inventory modelling, capacity analysis, distribution flow and purchasing analytics). You will get to know a wide variety of supply chains and you will influence multi million-dollar decisions. You will act as primary enthusiast for the power of technology, data, and predictive and prescriptive analysis.
Effective communicators, self-driven and able to drive insights into actions that improve business results. Interpersonal and communication skills are crucial to thrive in a multi-functional leadership team. Your job is to communicate complex data or algorithms into simple conclusions that will empower others to act based on the insights you derive.
Technically Capable: Data Scientists “roll up their sleeves”, using data visualization (Spotfire, Tableau), and analytic tools (R, Python, SAS, JMP, Hive/Impala, etc.) to grasp the business building insights in our mountains of data. You should be adept at applying such technologies for solving ad hoc business problems, innovating on potential future solutions, and working with technology partners to translate your innovations into robust, scaled, analytic solutions.


Job Qualifications

YOU ARE THE RIGHT FIT IF YOU ARE/HAVE:


A Master in a quantitative degree (Operation Research, Statistics, Systems Engineering, Decision Sciences, Computer Science, Applied Math, Economics etc.);
English fluency;
Strong technical & analytical skill (R, SAS, SQL, optimization, simulation, predictive modeling etc);
Great leadership skills, problem solving and priority setting;
Excellent collaboration skills and working comfortably across teams;
have passion to transform how decisions are made through adhoc & scaled application of analytics;
preferably have some experience in CPG (FMCG), supply chain, analytics or consulting; can demonstrate success at deriving insight from data and effectively communicating those insights to drive action.


Your Advantages


A fixed contract, with an attractive compensation package;
Competitive pay, including monthly salary, 13th month at the end of the year as well as an annual variable bonus.
A flexible benefits plan to customize to your personal needs and kilometer allowance/public transport reduction;
Hospitalization plan after 6 months of employment, pension plan, life insurance plan, long term illness insurance and stock purchase plan;
Access to Benefits at work platform: A large benefits platform with employee discounts on renowned shops and online commercial platforms as well as on leisure activities and well-known amusement parks;
Working in an international and inclusive environment, with diverse and supporting colleagues.
Continuous self-development via coaching, trainings and a general Growth Mindset working environment;
A vibrant and modern working environment, supporting employees’ wellbeing:
Subsidized company restaurant;
On-site vibrant Café for breaks and less formal meetings;
On-site fitness room and possibility to join regular group sport activities;
Flexibility in terms of working hours and remote working for a good balance between personal needs and the job to be done.
Employee Assistance Program: free professional counseling services, work-life resources, and mental health support.
Supporting employees’ commute: plenty of parking facilities for both cars and bikes, shower facilities, shuttle between Heizel metro and the office, carpooling community.


ARE YOU EXCITED ABOUT THE ROLE? DEEP DIVE INTO P&G AND CHECK THE BELOW INSIGHTFUL LINKS:


Our hiring process consists of three main steps: 1) application, 2) online assessments and 3) interviews. Click here to get all the tips to be fully prepared.
P&G is driven to make life better, not just within the company, but across the globe. Click here to check out how we make a meaningful impact on the world.
We are the world’s largest consumer goods company. Click here to discover about our iconic brands.


At P&G #weseeequal

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. At P&G, we strive to build a culture where everyone feels welcome, included, and able to bring their full selves to work.

We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process. Please click here if you require an accommodation during the application process. Please make sure to wait to hear back from us regarding your accommodation before proceeding with the online assessment, we thank you in advance for your patience.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Bij Customaite transformeren we de douanemarkt met een robuust AI SaaS-product om douaneaangiften te versnellen. Ons product heeft het vertrouwen gewonnen van toonaangevende bedrijven in de logistieke sector, en we zijn klaar om dit verder op te schalen.

Vanuit Leuven werken we met een klein, dynamisch team en omarmen we een echte start-up mentaliteit, terwijl we profiteren van de middelen en expertise van ons moederbedrijf AE.




Als Machine Learning Engineer speel je een cruciale rol in de AI-systemen die ons product aandrijven om automatisch douaneaangiften voor te bereiden.




Wat is je focus?

Je werkt samen met je team aan nieuwe algoritmes en modellen voor gegevensextractie.
Je past onze bestaande algoritmes aan en optimaliseert ze voor meer efficiëntie en kwaliteit.
Je implementeert schaalbare Machine Learning modellen in onze productieomgeving.
Je verkent nieuwe technologieën om ons groeiende product vooruit te helpen.




Wie ben jij?

Je hebt een master diploma in Computerwetenschappen (of equivalent) met een specialisatie in AI.
Je hebt sterke software engineering skills.
Je hebt een product- en start-up mentaliteit, met een drive voor ondernemerschap en ownership.
Je hebt ervaring met Python en cloudtechnologie.
Je hebt ervaring met het implementeren van ML modellen in productieomgevingen.
Je hebt aantoonbare ervaring in Intelligent Document Processing projecten met behulp van NLP.
Je wil deel uitmaken van een productteam en bijdragen aan de toekomst van ons product.
Je beheerst het Nederlands goed, aangezien ons team in Leuven werkt en voornamelijk Nederlands spreekt.




Wat biedt Customaite jou?

Een uitdagende rol in een dynamische werkomgeving met veel ruimte voor initiatief.
Direct zichtbare impact op het product.
Een mensgerichte organisatie met een collegiale atmosfeer.
Een hybride werksysteem met veel flexibiliteit.




Zie jij jezelf in deze rol?




Reageer vandaag nog of solliciteer via deze pagina (AE - Machine Learning Engineer) en ontdek hoe jij een verschil kunt maken bij Customaite. Heb je vragen over de job, ons sollicitatieproces of onze unieke bedrijfscultuur? Neem contact op via onze Recruitment Lead voor Customaite: julie.vandenbossche@ae.be

 

Bij Customaite houden we van een persoonlijke aanpak en korte lijnen. Of je nu digitaal of fysiek langskomt, we kijken ernaar uit om je te ontmoeten!

Show more

Title: Junior Data Scientist (B2B SaaS in Brussels)
Description:
Join Novable, a pioneering force in corporate innovation. We connect startups with the industrial power of corporations to drive meaningful transformation.

Goal

Grow and maintain our cutting-edge database of innovative companies. Improve our Deep Matching technology to match the right startups with client needs.

Key Responsibilities


Work on R&D projects to improve smart crawlers through the use of LLM Agents
Develop efficient data processing pipelines
Develop evaluation processes for quality improvement
Improve our Deep Matching algorithm


Environment


Be part of a forward-thinking company with an inspiring mission to connect innovation with industrial power for global transformation.
Grow your skills by tackling challenging projects with real business impact.
Enjoy a fun work environment in Brussels, surrounded by passionate professionals committed to making an impact.


Profile


Strong Python skills
Familiar with MySQL and MongoDB
Passionate about generative AI and machine learning techniques
Familiar with Python API frameworks: Django, Flask, …
You love to solve problems, you can troubleshoot complex issues
Fun to work with, we take the sense of humour very seriously
Perfectly fluent in EN
Bonus: experience with AWS or other cloud provider


NOVABLE VISION: ENABLE INNOVATION THROUGH STARTUP RELATIONS

Novable is a tech startup active in the corporate innovation space, providing a startup scouting solution made of advanced technology software and dedicated analyst reviews. In particular, Novable develops an advanced AI-based technology to scout and match startups.

Startups have the innovation power - We believe that startup ecosystems (entrepreneurs, startups, scaleups, hubs, accelerators, venture capital funds) are a glimpse of the future, as they crystallize the forefront of technology innovation everywhere in the world. They are the crystal ball to anticipate future industry trends.

Corporations have the industrial power - On the other side, we believe that corporations have the necessary resources to get things done and to put the best ideas at work on a global scale. In that sense, it is critical that they collaborate with startups, not only for themselves, not only for their survival but also for the greater good of humanity on this planet.

Bring the best of those two worlds together - We are technology optimists. We believe that tech innovation can contribute to solving major societal issues and world problems, provided that enough industrial power is injected into the process. We envision a world where innovation and industry powers connect seamlessly and globally, to speed up the world’s transformation.

Novable mission is to enable innovation through startup relations, by connecting the brightest minds from the startup ecosystem with the strong industrial ambitions of the business world. We allow corporations and companies to identify the most suitable, enterprise-ready innovations matching their strategic agenda.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
As an Data Scientist, you will play a key role in developing end-to-end solutions for AI use cases. By taking up a use case right from the start you will help business define and scope the problem, pick the right ML solution and technology as well as ensure implementation, integration and deployment of your solution to production. You will do so while ensuring that our internal governance processes and best practices are respected. You will also collaborate with other team members in knowledge sharing as well as continuously improving our way of working.

Responsibilities

  • Develop AI applications using state-of-the-art (Gen)AI technology;
  • Translate business requests into AI applications;
  • Identify high-value use cases through data exploration and visualization;
  • Pilot prototypes in production processes to demonstrate their value;
  • Deploy prototypes to production, with support of IT, to obtain reliable, scalable systems;
  • Present your results in a clear manner and discuss them with multi-functional project teams;
  • Work in close collaboration with business experts (e.g. for requirement gathering, data source identification, data and process understanding, feature engineering, result validation, etc.), with IT (e.g. for ETL, deployment to production, etc.) and with other AI engineers in the team (e.g. for knowledge sharing).

Profile

  • PhD or Master's degree in a quantitative field (Artificial Intelligence, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, etc.)
  • 3+ years of relevant work experience in a business environment

Technical Skills

  • Hands-on experience with Python and its AI ecosystem;
  • Strong knowledge of state-of-the-art AI and statistical methods;
  • Experience with cloud technology (Azure);
  • Experience using LLM’s and commonly used libraries to interact with LLM’s (Langchain, Llamaindex, ...) is an asset;
  • Proven proficiency in the end-to-end AI project life cycle, including:
  • Translating business requests into data requirements.
  • Identifying high-value use cases through data exploration and visualization.
  • Developing AI solutions (incl. feature engineering, model fitting, etc.).
  • Deploying scalable AI applications to production.
  • Any experience with following elements is a plus:
  • MLOps practices, e.g. orchestration with Airflow, Gitlab CI/CD, etc.

Attitudes/Behavior

  • Passionate about AI and a constant learner;
  • Result-oriented and highly proficient in transforming data into actionable insights that create business value;
  • Team player with strong communication and presentation skills;
  • Able to manage AI projects in an autonomous way and drive collaboration with domain experts, data engineers and other AI engineers;
  • Knowledge in the field of telecommunications is a plus.

Languages

  • Fluent in Dutch and/or French (mandatory) + Fluent in English.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
About the job




🤠 What you'll be doing

Design, develop, and deploy machine learning models in production environments
Build and maintain scalable data pipelines to support model training and inference
Collaborate with data scientists to translate prototypes into robust, production-ready solutions
Optimize machine learning models for performance, scalability, and reliability
Implement MLOps best practices for continuous integration, delivery, and monitoring of ML systems
Develop APIs and services to expose machine learning models to applications and users
Troubleshoot and debug issues in machine learning workflows and infrastructure
Evaluate and implement new tools, frameworks, and platforms to improve the ML lifecycle
Work closely with software engineers and data engineers to ensure seamless integration
Document processes, architectures, and solutions for maintainability and knowledge sharing




🤓 Skills & qualifications

3+ years of experience as an ML engineer or in a related role
Strong programming skills in Python and familiarity with frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Scikit-learn
Proficiency in deploying models using containerization (e.g., Docker) and orchestration tools (e.g., Kubernetes)
Hands-on experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) for machine learning workflows
Expertise in data engineering and big data technologies (e.g., Spark, Hadoop)
Knowledge of MLOps tools and practices (e.g., MLflow, Airflow, CI/CD pipelines)
Familiarity with software engineering principles, version control systems, and APIs
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work on cross-functional teams
Fluent in [Language A] and [Language B] + professional-level English
Passion for creating scalable, reliable, and impactful machine learning solutions




😍 Movify offers

Exciting opportunities to work on state-of-the-art machine learning applications
A culture that values innovation, autonomy, and collaboration
Ongoing training and certifications to keep you ahead in the fast-evolving ML landscape
Access to cutting-edge tools and technologies
Flexible work arrangements and a focus on work-life balance
Competitive salary with performance-based incentives
A supportive team environment that encourages learning and growth
Regular team-building activities and a vibrant, inclusive company culture
The chance to shape the future of machine learning applications at our client side

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Location(s):


Avenue Louise 250, 1050, Brussels, BE


Line Of Business: Data Solutions OU(DAAS OU)

Job Category


Engineering & Technology


Experience Level: Experienced Hire

At Moody's, we unite the brightest minds to turn today’s risks into tomorrow’s opportunities. We do this by striving to create an inclusive environment where everyone feels welcome to be who they are-with the freedom to exchange ideas, think innovatively, and listen to each other and customers in meaningful ways.

If you are excited about this opportunity but do not meet every single requirement, please apply! You still may be a great fit for this role or other open roles. We are seeking candidates who model our values: invest in every relationship, lead with curiosity, champion diverse perspectives, turn inputs into actions, and uphold trust through integrity.

About The Role

We're looking for a Data Scientist with a strong focus on prompt architecture and engineering to join our dynamic team. In this role, you will be at the forefront of developing cutting-edge solutions leveraging large language models (LLMs) and other AI technologies. You will play a critical role in designing, implementing, and optimizing prompt engineering strategies to enhance the performance and efficiency of our AI systems.

Location: Brussels

Key Responsibilities


Design innovative solutions to solve real business problems, working with teams to understand their needs and identify automation opportunities.
Design, develop, and test prompts for various LLMs and generative AI models, focusing on achieving specific outcomes and maximizing model performance.
Develop and maintain a prompt library and framework for consistent and scalable prompt engineering across different projects.
Conduct rigorous experiments to evaluate LLMs and prompt effectiveness, identify areas for improvement, and iterate on prompt design.
Explore and implement advanced prompt engineering techniques, including few-shot learning, chain-of-thought prompting, and retrieval augmented generation.
Collaborate with data scientists, engineers, and product managers to integrate optimized prompts into production systems.
Analyze and interpret model outputs to identify potential biases, limitations, and areas for further refinement.
Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in AI, LLMs, and prompt engineering research and development.
Contribute to the development of best practices and guidelines for prompt engineering within the organization.
Document and share your findings, insights, and best practices with the team.


Requirements


Bachelor’s degree in computer science, data science, mathematics, or a related field.
At least 2 years of experience in a similar role, focusing on AI prompt engineering and architecture.
Strong understanding of NLP concepts and techniques, with experience working with LLMs and generative AI systems such as OpenAI GPT, Anthropic Claude, and Gemini.
Proven experience in prompt engineering, including prompt design, optimization, and evaluation.
Deep understanding of key prompt engineering concepts like zero-shot, few-shot, chain-of-thought, and constraint setting.
Solid understanding of statistical analysis and machine learning techniques.
Experience with data analysis and manipulation tools.
Strong programming skills in Python.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with a data-driven approach to decision-making.
Superior communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to explain complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and meet deadlines.


Preferred Qualifications


Eagerness to learn new technologies and adapt to industry trends and changes.
Familiarity with Agentic AI concepts.
Familiarity with different LLM APIs and deployment strategies.
Experience with cloud computing platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP).
Experience with version control systems (e.g., Git).


Moody’s is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender expression, gender identity or any other characteristic protected by law.

Candidates for Moody's Corporation may be asked to disclose securities holdings pursuant to Moody’s Policy for Securities Trading and the requirements of the position. Employment is contingent upon compliance with the Policy, including remediation of positions in those holdings as necessary.

Title: Junior Data Scientists
Description:
Are you passionate about data and its role in supporting European pollinator conservation? The EU Pollinator Hub seeks a highly motivated Junior Data Scientist to join our team.




LOCATION OF THE JOB: Remote (being registered in Belgium, Austria or Spain)

 

Your Role As a Junior Data Scientist, you will:

● Manage data uploaded to the platform, ensuring its integrity and relevance.

● Curate datasets to ensure alignment with scientifi c and community needs.

● Review data for quality, accuracy, and compliance with FAIR principles.

● Collaborate with researchers and stakeholders to support data-driven insights.

● Assist in improving workflows and tools for data management.




Your Profile

● Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science, Environmental Science, Statistics or a related fi eld.

● Profi ciency in data management tools and software (e.g., Python, R, SQL).

● Familiarity with FAIR data principles is highly desirable.

● Knowledge about WebGIS, PostGIS, etc., is an asset.

● Strong attention to detail and analytical skills.

● Fluency in English is mandatory; knowledge of additional EU languages is an asset.

● Interest in pollinator conservation and ecosystem services is a plus.




What We Offer

● A dynamic and international working environment.

● Opportunities for professional growth and contribution to impactful environmental initiatives.

● Flexible work arrangements and a supportive team.




Application Details To apply, send your CV and a cover letter explaining your motivation and relevant experience to simon@bee-life.eu

by 28th February.




Join us in making a difference for pollinators and the environment through the power of data!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
B.E.S. (Business and Engineering Solutions) is looking for a Data Scientist to coordinate, define and execute the data activities in the automotive sector.







Your responsabilities :

You implement feature engineering techniques to extract main features from events, manoeuvres, and trips,
You support study of driver behaviour based on time series big data and aggregated demographics,
You support Link Driver Behaviour comprehensive groups with market and persona data,
You provide support in the application of data science methods in study cases,
You analyse customer survey data and market data,




Your profile :

You have a Master degree,
You are fluent in English (written and spoken), French is a real asset,
You have a first experience (internship, apprenticeship) in data,
You are interested in working in a sector at the heart of innovation,
You have knowldege in Python,
You have experience with big data,
You can work autonomously.




What can you except as a B.E.S. consultant?




Great projects in Engineering and High Technologies through major players to develop your technical skills and hard skills
Knowledge sharing processes though our competences centers and experts' communities to grow your multi-sectorial knowledge
A strong development plan to improve your soft skills such as Leadership, Communication skills, Change & People management capabilities…
A full package made of gross salary on 13.92 months, lunch allowance, entertainment expenses, company car & fuel card, group insurances OR a VIE!
A friendly, lively working environment within a dynamic and motivated team !!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Permanent position only




WHAT IS CREAM ALL ABOUT?

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency…but in reality, we are a consulting company in Business & Technology active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport.




CREAM’S SPECIAL RECIPE:

1/3 of Personal development
1/3 of Collective Intelligence
1/3 of Intrapreneurship

Bonus ingredient: … Some passionate colleagues 😀




WHAT IS A DATA SCIENTIST AT CREAM?

As Robin, Data Scientist, you will have a key role in the implementation of innovative data models to solve specific business issues. You will be part of a challenging and multidisciplinary team. You will discover various industries.




YOUR TASKS:

You gather business requirements to better understand your client’s needs
You dive in a large amount of data to discover is hidden
You provide data-driven recommendations to the client
Based on your client’s needs, you apply predictive analysis and machine learning
You bring out concrete and predictive models
At the end, you help the business to better optimize the use of their data
data




HOW DO WE IMAGINE OUR FUTURE CONSULTANT?

You have at least 2 years of experience in Data Science
You want to learn more about Machine Learning, Robotics Process Automation (RPA)…
You are used to work with one of the following technologies : MATLAB, R, SAS, Python, Java …
You have good communication and synthesis skills
You are fluent in French and English; a good knowledge of Dutch is an asset




WHY SHOULD YOU TASTE CREAM/THE LIME FLAVOUR?

A broad diversity of career options: you’re not stuck in a box
You evolve in a learning environment where you can challenge your knowledge with your colleagues
You grow in a company that is at the leading edge of technology
You have the opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving company
We have values we share, live with, experiment every day

We just hire great people and give them the playing field to become awesome!




"THE LITTLE THING THAT CAN MAKE THE DIFFERENCE,

CREAM IS DEVELOPING A DIVERSITY PLAN AND WOULD LIKE THAT ALL ITS MEMBERS REFLECT THE SOCIETY IN ALL ITS DIVERSITY"

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
AddanEx JOB POSTING:

Title: Data Scientist

Location: Remote

Type: Contract

Start Date: ASAP / February

Duration: 6 Months + Extensions

Utilisation: 40 Hours per week

Languages: English







The role as a Data Scientist –As part of our team, you will be taking part in the implementation and operation of state-of-the-art data science and optimization solutions, which are scalable and innovative in the way the data is processed, managed and analyzed. You will work with real and unique datasets used to improve how we organize, plan and perform their business. You will communicate with business stakeholders to present key insights, explain the analytical models, and support them by providing information to improve decision-making and drive change




Job Summary / Key Skills

3+ years of working experience working within data science capacity, as well as work experience in applying optimization techniques to real-world problems
Experience working with Python and experience working with libraries and tools for machine learning, such as xgboost, sklearn. In addition, libraries and tools focusing on optimization, such as OR-tools, Scikit-opt, Gurobi, CPLEX, etc.
Strong analytical skills to dissect complex problems and formulate them into solvable tasks, the ability to think creatively and develop innovative solutions
An understanding of various optimization techniques both linear and nonlinear, such as constrained and unconstrained optimization, and algorithms such as simulated annealing, tabu search, etc.
Ability to apply optimization techniques to solve complex real-world problems, such as resource allocation, portfolio optimization, route optimization, etc.
A plus is if you have worked with version control, e.g. Git A plus if you have worked with GIS, geographic information systems, and presenting geodata using Python libraries, e.g., Dash or Streamlit.




If you are interested in this opportunity, please apply now with your updated CV in MS Word format to Applications@AddanEx.com

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
About Us:

Wajusoft specializes in connecting visionary startups with top-tier software engineers, with a focus on fueling innovation and growth. Our mission is to democratize access to tech talent and create opportunities for engineers to work with transformative teams. We envision a future where startups overcome technological boundaries and reshape industries through innovation. Our rigorous vetting process ensures that only exceptional engineers join our network, combining technical assessments with cultural fit evaluations.




Key Responsibilities:

Design and implement distributed data processing systems for real-time analysis of public data and threat detection.
Lead research and development in machine learning, NLP, computer vision, and data analytics.
Oversee the gathering and annotating of custom datasets for tasks like classification, unsupervised pre-training, and tagging.
Lead the optimization of ETL processes for various data formats from social media, news, and web sources.
Develop and manage the database architecture for real-time streaming analytics, focusing on performance and scalability.
Drive automation, continuous integration, deployment, and performance optimization efforts while ensuring strict security compliance.
Design, implement, and optimize robust REST APIs and ensure data correctness through test suites and instrumentation.
Lead development initiatives, manage feature rollouts, and make strategic decisions on project trade-offs (e.g., cost vs. performance).
Apply machine learning performance evaluation techniques to identify and address system limitations.




Required Qualifications:

6+ years of software engineering experience.
Extensive years of experience in data engineering and building data platforms.
3+ years of experience in Machine Learning or a closely related field.
Proven track record of deploying cloud-based products and optimizing processing pipelines for streaming analytics.
Proficiency with SQL and NoSQL databases (e.g., PostgreSQL, MongoDB, ElasticSearch, Redis, Druid).
Expertise in Kafka, Airflow, and big data processing systems (e.g., Apache Spark, Flink, Beam).
Strong Python coding skills and experience with build automation, CI/CD tools.
Strong project management skills with the ability to lead teams and deliver complex projects.




Desirable Skills:

Experience with AWS and cloud services.
Familiarity with MLOps frameworks like Kubeflow, MLFlow.
Experience with generative models and AI/ML deployments.
Published research or contributions to open-source machine learning projects.
Track record of success in online competitions like Kaggle.

Title: Data Scientist - ML
Description:
RED Global is currently recruiting for a Data Scientist - ML for our client, a global organisation who are scaling up their data capability. They are looking to bring on board an experienced Data Scientist with experience of Machine Learning, GenAI and solution architecture and software engineering.







Key Responsibilities:

Responsible to support and advice various clients to identify and define problems and resolve these complex issues for the business.
You will interact with graph databases through standardized APIs and query languages and work with ETL Prosses.
Use AI techniques such as GenAI, supervised and un-supervised machine learning techniques.
Work across the latest data science platforms (Databricks, Dataiku, AzureML, SageMaker) and frameworks (e.g., Tensorflow, PyTorch, MXNet, scikit-learn).
Support with building and deploying solutions to Cloud (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) including Cloud provisioning tools (e.g., Terraform).
Advising to the business stakeholders on data driven marketing - working closely with third parties and, internally, with digital teams, IT, and others.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English and French/Dutch with good senior-level stakeholder management soft skills and competencies.




Required skills:

3-5 years experiences as a Data Scientist working within global organisations.
Extensive work experience of various Data Science Platforms such as Databricks, Dataiku, AzureML, SageMaker) and frameworks such as Tensorflow, PyTorch, MXNet, scikit-learn.
Experience building and deploying solutions to Cloud (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud).
Must have technical knowledge of Machine Learning (ML) or GenAI.
Industry skills: Manufacturing or Life sciences would be a plus.
Strong analytical skills and appreciation of coding languages, data sources, data matching and data acquisition.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Job Description

We are seeking a skilled and experienced Machine Learning Engineer to design, develop, and deploy advanced machine learning models and frameworks. The ideal candidate will collaborate with cross-functional teams to build scalable ML solutions and optimize real-time data-driven applications, ensuring high accuracy, efficiency, and reliability.

Responsibilities


Develop, deploy, and maintain a robust Machine Learning (ML) platform using cloud frameworks to standardize and democratize ML model utilization across the organization securely and efficiently.
Design and implement advanced ML models to support event-driven, streaming, real-time, and low-latency applications.
Continuously monitor, optimize, and update ML models to ensure accuracy, reliability, and peak performance.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business requirements and translate them into scalable, reusable ML solutions.
Stay informed about emerging ML trends and technologies, suggesting and implementing innovative practices to keep the company at the forefront of the ML field.
Communicate complex ML concepts effectively to various stakeholders, ensuring clarity across different levels of seniority and technical expertise.


Qualification


Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, or a related field.
5+ years of experience developing and deploying ML models, including building online feature stores for real-time, low-latency applications.
Hands-on experience with AWS SageMaker and cloud-based ML environments.


Technical Skills


Machine Learning model development and deployment
Online feature store implementation
Cloud frameworks
Real-time data analytics
ML frameworks
MLOps tools and practices


Soft Skills


Strong communication skills for both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Proactive approach to staying updated with industry trends
Team collaboration and stakeholder management


Hiring Team Member

Avula Srivalli

Recruitment Coordinator


LinkedIn
Mail

  • Design and implement advanced ML models to support event-driven, streaming, real-time, and low-latency applications.
  • Continuously monitor, optimize, and update ML models to ensure accuracy, reliability, and peak performance.
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business requirements and translate them into scalable, reusable ML solutions.
  • Stay informed about emerging ML trends and technologies, suggesting and implementing innovative practices to keep the company at the forefront of the ML field.
  • Communicate complex ML concepts effectively to various stakeholders, ensuring clarity across different levels of seniority and technical expertise.

Qualification

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, or a related field.
  • 5+ years of experience developing and deploying ML models, including building online feature stores for real-time, low-latency applications.
  • Hands-on experience with AWS SageMaker and cloud-based ML environments.

Technical Skills

  • Machine Learning model development and deployment
  • Online feature store implementation
  • Cloud frameworks
  • Real-time data analytics
  • ML frameworks
  • MLOps tools and practices

Soft Skills

  • Strong communication skills for both technical and non-technical stakeholders
  • Proactive approach to staying updated with industry trends
  • Team collaboration and stakeholder management

Hiring Team Member

Avula Srivalli

Recruitment Coordinator

  • LinkedIn
  • Mail

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We’re looking for a Data Scientist to join our team and help shape the future of contextual advertising as we continue to expand globally.




Who We Are

At Seedtag our goal is to lead the change in the advertising industry because we believe that effective advertising should not be at odds with users’ privacy.

By combining Natural Language Processing and Computer Vision our proprietary, Machine Learning-based technology provides a human-like understanding of the content of the web that finds the best context for each ad while providing unparalleled risk-mitigation capabilities that protect advertisers from showing their ads on pages that could be damaging for their brand. All of this, without relying on cookies or any other tracking mechanisms.

Every day, our teams develop new services that reach over 200 million users worldwide with fast response times to ensure that we deliver the best user experience. We’re fully committed to the DevOps culture, where we provide the platform that our Software Developers and Data Scientists use to manage over 100 different microservices, pushing dozens of changes to production every day. All of this is built on top of Kubernetes in Google Cloud Platform and Amazon Web Services.

If you are interested in joining one of the fastest-growing scale-ups in Europe and working on massive scalability challenges, this is the place for you.




Your Challenge

As a member of our data science team, you will take on the task of developing bidding optimizations through NLP applications, such as large language models, scalable embeddings, and network analysis solutions.
You will be responsible for building and improving bidding functionalities which will have a direct impact on our client’s advertising KPIs.
You will explore the applicability of LLMs for production, crafting solutions that can handle real-world, large-scale challenges, particularly in areas like contextualization, personalization, and relevance optimization.
You will work on end-to-end projects, taking solutions from concept to production, and focusing on creating scalable, efficient, and impactful solutions.
Collaborating closely with our cross-functional teams, your work will be aligned with business goals and drive the practical application of your solutions.




Our core values

Outcome over output

Our core tech values reflect our commitment to delivering exceptional results, fostering a culture of continuous learning, and always putting the customer's needs first. We believe that success comes from focusing on the outcomes rather than just the output. Our tech team aims to solve problems that make a meaningful difference, and we measure our success by the impact we have on the customer.

Failure is allowed, learning is a must

We also recognize that failure is an inevitable part of the innovation process. Our team understands that setbacks are opportunities to learn and grow. We believe in testing early and often, and we continuously iterate and improve until we arrive at the best solution.

We are all scouts

Another core value we hold is that we are all scouts. We believe in leaving things better than we found them. This means we take ownership of our work and strive to improve the systems and processes we touch. We encourage our team members to be proactive in identifying areas for improvement, and we value those who take the initiative to implement positive changes. Our goal is to leave a lasting, positive impact on our projects and our team.

We are data-driven

Lastly, our team is data-driven. We believe that making informed decisions based on data is crucial to our success. Our team uses data to guide our decision-making process and to identify opportunities for improvement. We are committed to using data to continuously monitor and optimize our models and processes to ensure that we are delivering the best possible outcome for our customers.




Tech Stack

We have to support 120k requests per second running with ML models in production answering within 10 milliseconds! We have this running in production with Python and GoLang microservices using datalakes, GCS, Redis, Kinesis or Kafka. All this is constantly deployed in GCP using Kubernetes and other kinds of production stacks. The current stack outputs 20 TB of daily data having them ready to use for analytics and more with easy and low latency access.

In the rest of the company, we also develop in Typescript for Nodejs and Scala making use of technologies like Kafka, Druid and MongoDB all over the Google Cloud Platform.




What You’ll Need to Succeed

You bring 3-5 years of experience in data science and machine learning, with relevant experience in developing ML/NLP applications at scale to address real-world business challenges.
You possess strong software engineering skills and a track record of deploying machine learning models in production environments, with proficiency in Python and experience in libraries relevant to NLP and embedding frameworks.
You have a strong academic background in fields such as Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, or similar, with a focus on quantitative analysis and problem-solving.
You have hands-on experience with end-to-end project workflows, from data exploration to deployment, proven ability to scale embeddings for high-volume data environments, and are skilled at managing both the technical and business aspects of data projects.
You are proactive, entrepreneurial, and adaptable, with a commitment to leveraging data and machine learning to drive impactful, measurable business outcomes in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.




Why Join Seedtag?

Growth & Opportunity: A key moment to join with vast career development prospects.

Flexibility: At Seedtag, we trust you to balance work and life effortlessly with the option to a 100% remote (Please note that while we operate as a 100% remote company, we can only extend contracts within Europe in countries where we have established legal entities: Spain, Italy, the UK, Belgium, the Netherlands, France, and Germany) or hybrid work setup, depending on what works best.

Learning & Development: Online courses in ODILO, and optional English or Spanish group classes.

Inclusive Culture: We foster a supportive environment that values personal growth.

Fun & Connection: Participate in team activities, company offsites, and more!




Additional Perks

Flexible benefits plan: Restaurant, transportation, and kindergarten vouchers.
Health insurance: Comprehensive coverage included.
Gympass: Access to wellness programs and fitness classes.
Seedsave Program: Exclusive discounts to help you save for the future.
Build your home office with a gross budget of up to 1K€ (external screen, chair, table...)
Paid travels to our HQ in Madrid to work p2p with your squad members
Macbook Pro M3




Ready to join the Seedtag adventure? Send us your CV and let’s grow together!




At Seedtag, we’re committed to creating an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive. We welcome diverse perspectives as they fuel our innovation and growth. Please let us know if you require accommodations during the hiring process and we’ll ensure a positive and accessible experience.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
At WeDoData we are working with a global leader in the Online gambling / iGaming sector who are looking to hire a Data Scientist to join their team.




Fully remote

60K EUR mid

80K EUR senior

10-15k annual bonus




What You Will Do

Design and develop advanced ML algorithms for image, text, audio, and tabular data
Develop and optimize pipelines in Azure to train models across various domains
Implement end-to-end applications in Python, including unit and integration tests
Continuously monitor system performance and troubleshoot issues
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to produce solutions to complex problems
Develop common packages and tools for logging, model inference, and more

Required Qualifications and Experience

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field
Strong proficiency in Python, PyTorch, and TensorFlow
Proven experience in managing and analyzing large datasets
Solid understanding of foundational DL algorithms
Expertise in unit and integration tests (Pytest) and CICD pipelines
Experience with data versioning, model management, experiment tracking, key evaluation metrics, and optimization techniques
Extensive knowledge and hands-on experience in Docker
Solid understanding of traditional Computer Vision and classical ML

Nice to Have

In-depth experience with computer vision models for object detection, image classification, and segmentation
Experience with Azure services (ML Studio, Data Factory, Functions, Blob Storage) or equivalent cloud provider services
Knowledge of AWS (Amazon Web Services) services, especially EC2 and S3
Experience with Huggingface Transformers, Elastic Stack, Gitlab CI pipelines
Experience with Prompt Engineering, Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG), LLM frameworks (LangChain, LlamaIndex, Haystack, ...), and fine-tuning LLMs

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
Sciensano verbindt gezondheid, wetenschap en samenleving en telt meer dan 900 medewerkers die zich elke dag opnieuw inzetten voor de gezondheid van mens en dier. Zoals uit onze naam blijkt, vormen wetenschap en gezondheid de kern van ons bestaan. De kracht van Sciensano ligt in de holistische en multidisciplinaire benadering van gezondheid. Onze aandacht gaat daarbij uit naar het nauwe en onlosmakelijke verband tussen de gezondheid van mensen en die van dieren, en hun omgeving (het “One health” concept). Daarom combineren we meerdere invalshoeken in ons onderzoek om op een unieke manier bij te dragen aan ieders gezondheid. Sciensano kan hiervoor verder bouwen op de meer dan 100 jaar wetenschappelijke expertise van het voormalige Centrum voor Onderzoek in Diergeneeskunde en Agrochemie (CODA) en het vroegere Wetenschappelijk Instituut Volksgezondheid (WIV). Voor meer informatie over onze projecten en activiteiten : https://www.sciensano.be.


De Sciensano wetenschappelijke dienst “1160: Zorg-gerelateerde infecties en antibioticaresistentie”, biedt de zorginstellingen de nodige hulpmiddelen voor de opvolging van zorginfecties, antibioticumresistentie en het gebruik van antimicrobiële middelen. Met onze onderzoeks- en surveillanceactiviteiten helpen wij de antibioticumresistentie te beperken in acute en chronische zorginstellingen. Wij stellen onze expertise ook ten dienste van de gezondheidsautoriteiten en bieden steun op het terrein bij epidemieën, onder meer gerelateerd aan bacteriën die resistent zijn tegen verschillende antibiotica of SARS-CoV-2.

Binnen de unit “Zorginfecties (ZI)” van vermelde dienst, als “data manager/scientist”, en in samenwerking met de unit lead, ZI-surveillance coördinatoren, Sciensano diensten Healthdata en ICT, de contactpersonen binnen de algemene ziekenhuizen in België, en de stakeholders voor de nationale en internationale ZI preventie- en controle strategie:

  • Bijdragen aan de jaarlijkse organisatie van gegevens-ontvangst, -verwerking, -validatie, -analyse en resultaats-rapportage van ZI surveillances en/of registers “NSIH-DENO”, “NSIH-HOSP”, “NSIH-SEP”, “NSIH-CDI”, “NSIH-SSI”, “NSIH-ICU”, en “ILI_NH”. Voor de vermelde taken en registers, de ontwikkeling en het onderhoud van structurele en reproduceerbare procedures zoals scripts of data-pipelines, en met de voorhanden zijnde hulpmiddelen zoals SAS, R, STATA, MS Excel, en Latex.
  • Instaan voor de jaarlijkse coördinatie van het “NSIH-DENO” register, meer bepaald het onderhoud en de opvolging van het protocol voor nationale gestandaardiseerde gegevensinzameling, van tool(s) voor lokale gegevensverzameling in samenwerking met de dienst Healthdata of ICT, en de operationale gegevens-ontvangst, -validatie, -analyse en resultaats-rapportage indien van toepassing.

Punctuele ondersteuning met betrekking tot de taken van gegevens-ontvangst, -verwerking, -analyse en resultaats-rapportage bij andere projecten binnen de Sciensano wetenschappelijke dienst “1160: Zorggerelateerde infecties en antibiotica resistentie”.


  • Burgerlijk, Bio, of Industrieel Ingenieur, Master in de wiskunde, ICT, statistiek, bio informatica of gelijkwaardig;
  • Goede kennis van en/of ervaring met methoden en tools voor gegevensverwerking, -analyse en resultaats -rapportage, zoals SAS, R, STATA;
  • Goede kennis van en/of ervaring met data integratie-en datastroom concepten en -technieken;
  • Kennis en/of ervaring met datawarehouse concepten, en -technieken bv SQL is een pluspunt;
  • Kennis en/of ervaring met tools voor gegevensverzameling zoals Limesurvey, Redcap, of andere is een pluspunt;
  • Interesse in wetenschappelijk onderzoek, en interesse in volksgezondheid in het algemeen en het domein van zorginfecties in het bijzonder;
  • Goede kennis van het Engels en het Nederlands en/of Frans (voldoende kennis van de andere landstaal);


Een uitdagende functie in een bekend wetenschappelijk instituut.

Arbeidsovereenkomst van bepaalde duur tem 31/12/2025.

Weddeschaal : SW11

Voordelen : gratis abonnement of 100% terugbetaling woon-werkverkeer met het openbaar vervoer; hospitalisatie- en groepsverzekering; maaltijdcheques; voordelen via FED+ (www.fedplus.be); andere sociale voordelen.

Andere : glijdende werkuren in een 38-uren week; mogelijkheid tot telewerk en opleidingen.


Stuur je kandidatuur in voor 31/01/2025 via onze website https://www.sciensano.be.


Heb je vragen omtrent deze functie of wens je bijkomende informatie?

Contacteer ons via jobs@sciensano.be.

Title: ML Engineer - Gen AI
Description:
Are you a passionate Machine Learning Engineer with expertise in generative AI?




In this role, you will collaborate closely with data scientists and engineers from our Cloud and DevSecOps teams to implement best practices and ensure technical excellence across multiple projects. Utilizing open-source frameworks like LangChain and Azure-based tools, including the Azure AI Services suite, you will maintain and expand our repository of AI assets. Your innovative mindset will help identify and develop state-of-the-art solutions that deliver business value, while your commitment to staying current with AI advancements will ensure our team remains at the forefront of technology.




As a member of the Machine Learning Enablers team, you will actively research and develop agent-based AI use cases, focusing on multi-agent systems. Your work will support the day-to-day needs of our data scientists through the practical maintenance and enhancement of AI assets, while also driving innovation in our AI initiatives.




Responsibilities:




Develop and Maintain our Generative AI Repository.

Manage and expand our repository of reusable Generative AI components on Azure DevOps, ensuring it’s robust, up-to-date, and user-friendly, and implements MLOps standadrs.
Collaborate with data scientists to identify new components to build, provide technical support, and promote best practices in using the repository.

Develop and Implement Agent-Based AI Solutions.

Research and experiment with multi-agent systems and emerging frameworks to address real-world use cases in Proximus’ context.
Develop proof-of-concept projects to validate innovative multi-agent AI applications.
Design and create reusable components that enable data scientists to integrate agent-based approaches into their projects.

Collaborate and Drive Technical Excellence.

Implement and promote machine learning best practices (e.g., MLFlow), ensuring high-quality standards across the team.
Stay current with the latest trends, models, and frameworks, and communicate them to the team.




Your Profile:

Master’s degree in Artificial Intelligence, Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related quantitative field.
A Ph.D. is a plus, especially with research in Generative AI or agent-based systems.
Minimum of 2 years of relevant work experience in a business environment.
Proven experience working with generative AI models and LLMs in real-world projects.
Demonstrated ability to develop proof-of-concept projects, and transition innovative solutions to production-ready components.
Strong collaboration and communication skills, with experience working alongside a diverse team of technical and non-technical stakeholders.




Technical Skills:

Strong coding skills in Python, with proficiency in software development best practices, including version control (e.g., Git) and DevOps (e.g., CI/CD pipelines).
Hands-on experience implementing MLOps best practices (e.g., experiment tracking with MLFlow).
Experience with Microsoft Azure and Azure AI Services.
Experience with LangChain and other Generative AI frameworks.
Ability to drive innovation by experimenting with new techniques and frameworks to solve real-world problems.
Familiarity with Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) architectures and improvement techniques.
Strong communication skills for providing technical support, mentorship, and clear guidance to team members.
Strong collaboration skills and ability to manage tasks independently.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with keen attention to detail.
Experience contributing to the development of reusable AI components or libraries, contributions to open-source AI projects is an asset.
Experience with multi-agent systems and related frameworks (e.g. LangGraph, CrewAI, AutoGen).
Familiarity with monitoring and evaluation tools for generative AI applications.
Fluent in English and preferably also French and/or Dutch.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
At WeDoData we are working with a global leader in the Online Gambling / iGaming sector looking to hire a Data Scientist specialized in NLP




Fully remote

60K Euro Mid

80K Euro Senior

Annual bonus of 10-15K







Job Description:




We are seeking an exceptional Data Scientist that with a profound understanding of Large Language Models (LLMs) and a strong background in Automatic Speech Recognition (ASR), with in-depth experience working on various NLP domains such as text summarization, language models, sentiment analysis, named entity recognition, machine translation, question answering, chatbots, speech recognition, and more.

Key responsibilities:




Design, build, and fine-tune large Language Model-based and approaches (e.g., Mixtral, Llama) for natural language understanding and generation tasks.
Train, fine-tune, and optimize Automatic Speech Recognition (ASR) models using our private datasets.
Develop, train, and evaluate custom NLP models for a variety of applications including text summarization, sentiment analysis, named entity recognition.
Conduct data curation, preprocessing, and feature engineering for NLP datasets.
Develop and improve existing pipelines to train, evaluate and deploy ML models.
Continuously monitor system performance, troubleshoot issues, and implement improvements/optimizations.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate NLP solutions into production environments.
Stay updated with the latest trends and advancements in NLP and deep learning.




Required Skills and Qualifications:




Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
Strong proficiency in Python, with extensive experience in PyTorch and/or TensorFlow.
Familiarity with NLP libraries such as NLTK, SpaCy, and Hugging Face Transformers.
Proven experience in managing and analysing large text and/or audio datasets.
Strong understanding of foundational DL algorithms.
Experience with unit and integration tests (Pytest) and CICD pipelines.
Experience with data versioning, model management, experiment tracking.
Familiarity with key evaluation metrics and optimization techniques.
Extensive knowledge and hands-on experience in Docker.
Excellent problem-solving, analytical, and communication skills.




Due to licencing restrictions, we are unable to hire candidates from the following locations;

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Location(s):


Avenue Louise 250, 1050, Brussels, BE


Line Of Business: Data Solutions OU(DAAS OU)

Job Category:


Engineering & Technology


Experience Level: Experienced Hire

At Moody's, we unite the brightest minds to turn today’s risks into tomorrow’s opportunities. We do this by striving to create an inclusive environment where everyone feels welcome to be who they are-with the freedom to exchange ideas, think innovatively, and listen to each other and customers in meaningful ways.

If you are excited about this opportunity but do not meet every single requirement, please apply! You still may be a great fit for this role or other open roles. We are seeking candidates who model our values: invest in every relationship, lead with curiosity, champion diverse perspectives, turn inputs into actions, and uphold trust through integrity.

About The Role

We're looking for a Data Scientist with a strong focus on prompt architecture and engineering to join our dynamic team. In this role, you will be at the forefront of developing cutting-edge solutions leveraging large language models (LLMs) and other AI technologies. You will play a critical role in designing, implementing, and optimizing prompt engineering strategies to enhance the performance and efficiency of our AI systems.

Location: Brussels

Key Responsibilities:


Design innovative solutions to solve real business problems, working with teams to understand their needs and identify automation opportunities.
Design, develop, and test prompts for various LLMs and generative AI models, focusing on achieving specific outcomes and maximizing model performance.
Develop and maintain a prompt library and framework for consistent and scalable prompt engineering across different projects.
Conduct rigorous experiments to evaluate LLMs and prompt effectiveness, identify areas for improvement, and iterate on prompt design.
Explore and implement advanced prompt engineering techniques, including few-shot learning, chain-of-thought prompting, and retrieval augmented generation.
Collaborate with data scientists, engineers, and product managers to integrate optimized prompts into production systems.
Analyze and interpret model outputs to identify potential biases, limitations, and areas for further refinement.
Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in AI, LLMs, and prompt engineering research and development.
Contribute to the development of best practices and guidelines for prompt engineering within the organization.
Document and share your findings, insights, and best practices with the team.


Requirements:


Bachelor’s degree in computer science, data science, mathematics, or a related field.
At least 2 years of experience in a similar role, focusing on AI prompt engineering and architecture.
Strong understanding of NLP concepts and techniques, with experience working with LLMs and generative AI systems such as OpenAI GPT, Anthropic Claude, and Gemini.
Proven experience in prompt engineering, including prompt design, optimization, and evaluation.
Deep understanding of key prompt engineering concepts like zero-shot, few-shot, chain-of-thought, and constraint setting.
Solid understanding of statistical analysis and machine learning techniques.
Experience with data analysis and manipulation tools.
Strong programming skills in Python.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with a data-driven approach to decision-making.
Superior communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to explain complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and meet deadlines.


Preferred Qualifications:


Eagerness to learn new technologies and adapt to industry trends and changes.
Familiarity with Agentic AI concepts.
Familiarity with different LLM APIs and deployment strategies.
Experience with cloud computing platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP).
Experience with version control systems (e.g., Git).


Moody’s is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender expression, gender identity or any other characteristic protected by law.

Candidates for Moody's Corporation may be asked to disclose securities holdings pursuant to Moody’s Policy for Securities Trading and the requirements of the position. Employment is contingent upon compliance with the Policy, including remediation of positions in those holdings as necessary.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Requisition ID: 2980

Location:

Louvain-la-Neuve, BE

Work regime: Full-Time

Kind of contract: Open Ended Contract

Mission

The Belgian, B-Corp certified company IBA has opened new ways to diagnose and fight cancer and is the global leader in the field of Proton Therapy, next to its activities in radiopharmaceuticals, industrial sterilization and dosimetry.

Challenges we trust you with

The Data team at IBA focuses on using data to add value to the lives of our customers and colleagues. We value agility, ownership, and we are not afraid to challenge the status quo.

Your mission is to help our business teams with extracting insights from data through statistics and artificial intelligence. You'll use your experience to work closely with our data engineers, data scientists and business domain experts to ensure that your projects deliver tangible value and help build IBA a competitive advantage through data. More concretely, you will contribute to applications for predictive maintenance, as well as demonstrate feasibility in ambitious R&D projects.

We are looking for an experienced data professional who can drive a data project end-to-end. This includes deep diving in the business domain, exploring available data, suggesting improvements for data collection, as well as building, deploying, and monitoring AI models and visualizing the results.

How will your first months look like?

First, you’ll get onboarded on our data infrastructure and get a better understanding of the tools we are using. Next, you’ll be introduced on your first data science challenges.

Must-have

What we value


At least 3 years of relevant experience
Solid foundation in all steps of CRISP-DM
Strong foundation in statistics and AI, through education or experience
Proven experience in delivering AI projects
Motivation to understand our business and integrate our domain knowledge
Strong communicator that can describe complex topics in a simple way
Fluent in English, French is a plus
Passionate about data


Nice To Have


Experience with time series and/or natural language projects
Experience with Databricks and Spark
Experience with predictive maintenance
Experience working in an R&D environment


Cherry on the cake

IBA Offers


Competitive salary and benefits, including a company car
Flexible home office policy (3days/week)
Career growth within a globally recognized leader in medical technology
A supportive team environment that values each member's development
A commitment to cutting-edge technology and solving challenging problems
Be part of a BCorp Certified company, balancing professional innovation with personal well-being


Join us at IBA, where you can be part of a dynamic team working on cutting-edge technology in the fight against cancer. Let's make a difference together!

Title: Senior Data Scientist - ML Engineer
Description:
Company Description

About Devoteam:

Devoteam is a leading consulting firm focused on digital transformation. We help our clients leverage technology to achieve their business goals. Our longstanding partnerships with leaders like AWS, Google Cloud, Microsoft, and ServiceNow amplify our capabilities, allowing us to deliver top-tier expertise and award-winning services.

For 30 years, we have always been on the next tech wave. Devoteam has guided organizations through the Internet and cloud. The next revolution? AI.

With 11,000 tech natives working in 25+ countries, we bring you highly skilled IT experts across Europe

At Devoteam, tech is in our DNA, and it’s the people we empower with tech. Now, with responsible AI, we’re ready to unlock a future where technology drives positive change.


Job Description

About the Role:

We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Senior Data Scientist - ML Engineer to join our growing Data & AI team (50 FTE) in Belgium. In this role, you will play a key part in designing, developing, and deploying machine learning solutions for our clients across various industries. You will collaborate with other data scientists, engineers, and consultants to deliver innovative and impactful solutions that address our clients' business challenges.

Responsibilities:

Design, develop, and deploy machine learning models and algorithms
Analyze large and complex datasets to identify patterns and insights
Build and maintain data pipelines for data ingestion, processing, and transformation
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business requirements and translate them into technical solutions
Stay up to date with the latest advancements in machine learning and artificial intelligence
Contribute to the development of Devoteam's data science and machine learning capabilities


Qualifications

Qualifications:

Master's degree or Ph.D. in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field
5+ years of experience in a data science or machine learning role
Strong programming skills in Python or R
Experience with machine learning frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or scikit-learn
Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or GCP
Experience with Databricks is a plus
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Fluent in English and proficiency in Dutch or French is mandatory.
Sponsorship for a work permit not possible



 

Bonus Points:

Experience with big data technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, or Hive
Experience with MLOps tools and practices
Experience with natural language processing or computer vision
Contributions to open-source projects or publications in relevant conferences or journals


Additional Information

Why choose us?

Thrive in a fast-growing, entrepreneurial environment
Work with innovative and impactful Cloud, Data & AI projects for industry-leading clients
Connect with extraordinary talents in a collaborative and diverse culture
Enjoy a healthy work-life balance in an inspiring, eco-friendly workplace
Competitive compensation package



At Devoteam, we combine strong values – respect, frankness, ambition, entrepreneurship & collaboration – with a fun and supportive environment that empowers you to innovate, grow, and succeed in the fast-paced world of Cloud, Data & AI.

 

Show more
