Title: Expert Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
🚀 Your Role

At Dataroots, our consulting services are focused on designing and delivering AI-powered solutions tailored to optimize business processes. As an Expert Machine Learning Engineer, you'll join a collaborative team focused on building machine learning models that bring production-ready solutions to life.




Your passion for data and its potential will allow you to develop, deploy, and optimize advanced machine learning models. You’ll experiment with the latest approaches to ensure that every client receives best-in-class solutions. Working closely with our Data Engineers, Cloud Architects, and Data Strategists, you’ll help execute projects across diverse industries with a comprehensive, quality-driven, end-to-end approach.




As a senior team member, you'll mentor your peers, share your expertise, and keep up with the latest advancements in the field, ensuring continuous growth for yourself and the team.




🎉 What you'll find at Dataroots

Since 2016, Dataroots has been committing its excellent consulting services to help clients excel in their data-driven operations. Our approach focuses on team well-being, fostering diversity, and promoting knowledge sharing. By focusing on these values, we've achieved healthy and sustainable growth over the years. Through our consulting services, we actively encourage professional growth by exposing our employees to different industries, tools, technologies,... broadening their scope in the process.

As part of the Talan Group, we are able to take this approach to the next level, adding the element of international mobility to our employees’ career journey.

Join a team where your work will have a direct impact on both our clients and our journey. Learn more about our DNA at [https://dataroots.io/our-dna].




💼 What we’re looking for

You bring the following qualities & experiences to the role:

Master’s or Doctorate in a quantitative field, with mastery in Machine Learning.
4+ years of industry experience in machine learning and big data.
In-depth understanding of software design principles.
Strong theoretical grounding and practical expertise in general machine learning and deep learning.
Strong skills in Python & SQL. Knowledge of an additional programming language is an advantage.
Proven track record in deploying ML models and deep expertise in MLOps.
Experience with containerization (Docker, Kubernetes) and orchestration tools like Airflow, Prefect or Dagster.
Solid grasp of cloud- & data engineering. Proven experience with cloud services like AWS, Azure, or GCP.
GenAI familiarity is a big advantage.
Excited to work with large datasets and be able to tackle problems pragmatically.
Excellent communication skills to translate complex solutions into clear client deliverables.
Fluency in English. Speaking Dutch/French fluently is a very big advantage.
Consulting experience is a big plus.




💰 The Offer

An attractive salary with extralegal benefits, including:

+ Mobility budget or a company car with fuel/charging card

+ Hospitalisation and group insurance

+ High-end laptop

+ Smartphone with subscription

+ Substantial amount of holidays

+ Meal vouchers

+ ...

Diverse and welcoming work environment, where you’ll collaborate & unwind with colleagues from different cultures and disciplines. The organisation of both fun & professional events and initiatives is actively encouraged and supported.
A training budget for individual and team learning opportunities.
Tons of team-building events and sports initiatives to stay connected and unwind.




📍 Where you’ll work

Our main offices are in Leuven and Ghent, with co-working spaces in Charleroi and Antwerp. These spaces are perfect for both focusing and unwinding with colleagues, as well as brainstorming sessions and team events. While much of your work can be performed remotely, you will also work on-site with clients.




🎯 Ready to join Dataroots?

Excited to join Dataroots as an Expert Machine Learning Engineer? We can't wait to meet you—apply today! 🎉

Show more
HTML:
🚀 Your Role

At Dataroots, our consulting services are focused on designing and delivering AI-powered solutions tailored to optimize business processes. As an Expert Machine Learning Engineer, you'll join a collaborative team focused on building machine learning models that bring production-ready solutions to life.


Your passion for data and its potential will allow you to develop, deploy, and optimize advanced machine learning models. You’ll experiment with the latest approaches to ensure that every client receives best-in-class solutions. Working closely with our Data Engineers, Cloud Architects, and Data Strategists, you’ll help execute projects across diverse industries with a comprehensive, quality-driven, end-to-end approach.


As a senior team member, you'll mentor your peers, share your expertise, and keep up with the latest advancements in the field, ensuring continuous growth for yourself and the team.


🎉 What you'll find at Dataroots

Since 2016, Dataroots has been committing its excellent consulting services to help clients excel in their data-driven operations. Our approach focuses on team well-being, fostering diversity, and promoting knowledge sharing. By focusing on these values, we've achieved healthy and sustainable growth over the years. Through our consulting services, we actively encourage professional growth by exposing our employees to different industries, tools, technologies,... broadening their scope in the process.

As part of the Talan Group, we are able to take this approach to the next level, adding the element of international mobility to our employees’ career journey.

Join a team where your work will have a direct impact on both our clients and our journey. Learn more about our DNA at [https://dataroots.io/our-dna].


💼 What we’re looking for

You bring the following qualities & experiences to the role:

  • Master’s or Doctorate in a quantitative field, with mastery in Machine Learning.
  • 4+ years of industry experience in machine learning and big data.
  • In-depth understanding of software design principles.
  • Strong theoretical grounding and practical expertise in general machine learning and deep learning.
  • Strong skills in Python & SQL. Knowledge of an additional programming language is an advantage.
  • Proven track record in deploying ML models and deep expertise in MLOps.
  • Experience with containerization (Docker, Kubernetes) and orchestration tools like Airflow, Prefect or Dagster.
  • Solid grasp of cloud- & data engineering. Proven experience with cloud services like AWS, Azure, or GCP.
  • GenAI familiarity is a big advantage.
  • Excited to work with large datasets and be able to tackle problems pragmatically.
  • Excellent communication skills to translate complex solutions into clear client deliverables.
  • Fluency in English. Speaking Dutch/French fluently is a very big advantage.
  • Consulting experience is a big plus.


💰 The Offer

  • An attractive salary with extralegal benefits, including:

+ Mobility budget or a company car with fuel/charging card

+ Hospitalisation and group insurance

+ High-end laptop

+ Smartphone with subscription

+ Substantial amount of holidays

+ Meal vouchers

+ ...

  • Diverse and welcoming work environment, where you’ll collaborate & unwind with colleagues from different cultures and disciplines. The organisation of both fun & professional events and initiatives is actively encouraged and supported.
  • A training budget for individual and team learning opportunities.
  • Tons of team-building events and sports initiatives to stay connected and unwind.


📍 Where you’ll work

Our main offices are in Leuven and Ghent, with co-working spaces in Charleroi and Antwerp. These spaces are perfect for both focusing and unwinding with colleagues, as well as brainstorming sessions and team events. While much of your work can be performed remotely, you will also work on-site with clients.

Title: AI Engineer-Public sector
Description:
Position Description

At CGI, we’re looking for AI experts who want to make a tangible impact. You’ll lead AI innovation, helping our clients unlock the true value of their data, while working with cutting-edge technologies in a team that values diversity and continuous learning.

Your role in our team


Lead AI Awareness: Conduct workshops to increase awareness of AI and demonstrate its value for our clients’ businesses.
Deliver AI Solutions: Use industry-specific methods to solve client challenges, create trusted data sets, and develop data pipelines for AI model training.
Accelerate Decision-Making: Guide clients toward “speed to trusted action” through AI solutions, discovering AI opportunities via AI Design Sprint workshops, and building AI centers of excellence with a focus on governance and ethical AI.
Develop & Optimize: Implement AI models and solutions, ensuring ethical and responsible practices, and optimize existing AI systems for better performance.
Full AI Lifecycle: Be involved in the full AI lifecycle, including data preparation, design, coding, testing, deployment, and support.
Best Practices & Knowledge Transfer: Create internal guidelines for AI, train internal teams, and contribute to best practices for ethical AI.
Stay Current: Keep up with the latest AI trends, technologies, and ethical standards, and address biases in AI datasets and models.
Document & Share: Maintain clear documentation of AI development processes and decisions, ensuring transparency


How You Strengthen Our Team

We need someone who can bring both expertise and a passion for AI:


Proven experience in developing and deploying machine learning models and AI solutions.
Expertise in at least 2 areas: Statistics, Regression, Clustering, Deep Learning, NLP, Computer Vision, Time Series, Machine Learning Visualization, or Tree Ensembles.
Proficiency in programming languages like Python, R, or Java, and familiarity with frameworks like TensorFlow or PyTorch.
Experience with big data technologies (Hadoop, Spark) and cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud).
Strong data management skills, including data preprocessing and analysis.
Excellent problem-solving skills and a collaborative mindset.
Commitment to ethical AI practices and staying up-to-date with the field’s advancements.
Ability to handle multiple projects in a dynamic environment.
Clear communication and documentation skills for both technical and non-technical audiences.
Fluency in French or Dutch, with strong English skills.
A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, AI, Data Science, or a related field.
Medior Profile: 3 to 5 years of experience.
Senior Profile: More than 5 years of experience, preferably with a public sector background.


A pre-employment screening is part of the application process

Why join CGI?

At CGI, we believe in responsible and human-centric AI. For over 30 years, we’ve helped organizations realize lasting value from their AI investments. We prioritize outcomes that benefit stakeholders and align with societal values. Here’s what we offer:


A collaborative environment in small, self-managing expert teams.
The opportunity to drive your career with space for continuous development.
Work with the latest AI technologies.
An attractive salary with excellent benefits.
A permanent contract from the start.
The opportunity to become a CGI shareholder.


What's in it for you ?


Direct impact on the future of AI within a leading IT & Business consultancy.
Work with the latest technologies in a supportive and dynamic environment.
Opportunities for career growth and continuous learning.
A focus on ethical AI and best practices in the field.
A diverse and inclusive workplace where your ideas are valued.


Join our team of experts and apply now!

Questions about the position? Ask them to Gregory Depasse, Director Consulting Services, Public sector, via gregory.depasse@cgi.com.

For more information about the application procedure, please contact recruiter Fabienne Philips fabienne.philips@cgi.com

We do not collaborate with external recruitment agencies. Therefore, unsolicited acquisition is not appreciated.

Your future duties and responsibilities

Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role

Together, as owners, let’s turn meaningful insights into action.

Life at CGI is rooted in ownership, teamwork, respect and belonging. Here, you’ll reach your full potential because…

You are invited to be an owner from day 1 as we work together to bring our Dream to life. That’s why we call ourselves CGI Partners rather than employees. We benefit from our collective success and actively shape our company’s strategy and direction.

Your work creates value. You’ll develop innovative solutions and build relationships with teammates and clients while accessing global capabilities to scale your ideas, embrace new opportunities, and benefit from expansive industry and technology expertise.

You’ll shape your career by joining a company built to grow and last. You’ll be supported by leaders who care about your health and well-being and provide you with opportunities to deepen your skills and broaden your horizons.

Come join our team—one of the largest IT and business consulting services firms in the world.

XX

Job Description

xx

Your future duties and responsibilities

Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role

Ensemble, en tant que propriétaires, mettons notre savoir-faire à l’œuvre.

La vie chez CGI est ancrée dans l’actionnariat, le travail d’équipe, le respect et un sentiment d’appartenance. Chez nous, vous pourrez exploiter votre plein potentiel parce que…

Nous vous invitons à devenir propriétaire dès le jour 1 alors que nous travaillons ensemble à faire de notre rêve une réalité. C’est pourquoi nous nous désignons comme associés de CGI, plutôt que comme employés. Nous tirons profit des retombées de notre succès collectif et contribuons activement à l’orientation et à la stratégie de notre entreprise.

Votre travail crée de la valeur. Vous élaborerez des solutions novatrices et développerez des relations durables avec vos collègues et clients, tout en ayant accès à des capacités mondiales pour concrétiser vos idées, saisir de nouvelles opportunités, et bénéficier d’une expertise sectorielle et technologique de pointe.

Vous ferez évoluer votre carrière en vous joignant à une entreprise bâtie pour croître et durer. Vous serez soutenus par des leaders qui ont votre santé et bien-être à cœur et qui vous permettront de saisir des occasions afin de parfaire vos compétences et élargir les horizons.

Joignez-vous à nous, l’une des plus importantes entreprises de conseil en technologie de l’information (TI) et en management au monde.

Title: IOT Engineer
Description:
Job Description

We are seeking a Senior IoT Software Engineer to join our dynamic IoT team. In this role, you will work on the design, development, and deployment of cutting-edge IoT solutions, focusing on creating scalable, secure, and efficient solutions for enterprise clients. This is an exciting opportunity to lead projects involving Azure IoT technologies, cloud solutions, and embedded devices.

Responsibilities


Design, develop, and deploy IoT solutions utilizing Azure IoT Edge, Azure IoT Hub, and other related services.
Implement edge data processing and analytics for real-time insights and efficient data management.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams including product managers, data scientists, and engineers to define and deliver innovative IoT solutions.
Lead development teams, providing mentorship and ensuring successful project execution.
Develop and deploy business applications on embedded devices, using C# and Python.
Contribute to system-level problem-solving, ensuring effective integration of hardware and software.
Oversee project management tasks, ensuring timely and successful project deliveries.
Apply security best practices for IoT and cloud solutions to safeguard data and system integrity.
Communicate effectively with internal teams and clients, demonstrating strong problem-solving and analytical abilities.
Play an active role in growing and scaling the IoT practice and expertise within the organization.


Requirements


7+ years of experience in software development, with a focus on IoT and cloud technologies.
Expertise with Azure IoT Edge, Azure IoT Hub, and related Azure services.
Proficiency in Linux and Yocto for embedded systems development.
Strong programming skills in C# and Python.
Proven experience leading development teams and managing successful projects.
Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills.
Strong knowledge of IoT security best practices for devices and cloud environments.
Upper-intermediate English proficiency for effective client communication.
Strong teamwork and collaboration skills in a distributed work environment.


Technical Skills


Azure
Python
Linux
Yocto
C#
IoT services


Hiring Team Member

Avula Srivalli

Recruitment Coordinator

Title: AI Engineering Internship
HTML:
Job Location

Brussels

Job Description

Do you have passion for technology and a desire to learn and grow continuously? Do you want to develop a platform for AI?

Then join P&G as an AI Engineering intern. Through your internship you will build your AI Engineering skills to help P&G's business processes to leverage AI.

The space of Image Segmentation is developing fast - what are the criteria for using "classic" vision (such as YOLO) versus GenAI versus few-shot segmentation?

Leveraging P&G's AI platform, how do you bring this to end-users / citizen developers?

YOUR CONTRIBUTION TO P&G’S SUCCESS:

  • Partner with data scientists, product managers, infrastructure engineers and peer AI Engineers to design, develop, operationalize, integrate, and scale new algorithmic products including Generative AI models;
  • Build enterprise AI platforms and accelerators to enable deployment of applications with AI core and access AI models via APIs or batch pipelines;
  • Develop high quality, standard-compliant and tested code. Contribute code to shared libraries;
  • Implement DevOps methodologies, DataOps and MLOps principles in day-to-day work;
  • Develop continuous integration and continuous delivery pipelines;
  • Continuously evaluate in proof of concepts, recommend best technologies and ML models.

Job Qualifications

YOU ARE THE RIGHT FIT IF YOU ARE/HAVE:

  • Pursuing a Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Engineering, Information Systems, or a related quantitative field;
  • Familiarity with programming languages such as Python;
  • Basic knowledge of machine learning, image segmentation is a plus;
  • Strong analytical skills and a passion for problem-solving;
  • A proactive attitude and eagerness to learn new technologies and methodologies.

YOUR ADVANTAGES:

  • A temporary contract for the duration of your internship, with an attractive compensation package;
  • Monthly allowance: 2319,5 EUR brut/month, prorated 13th month based on the months worked during your internship period;
  • A flexible benefits plan to customize to your personal needs and kilometer allowance/public transport reduction;
  • Access to Benefits at work platform: A large benefits platform with employee discounts on renowned shops and online commercial platforms as well as on leisure activities and well-known amusement parks;
  • Working in an international and inclusive environment, with diverse and supporting colleagues;
  • Continuous self-development via coaching, trainings and a general Growth Mindset working environment;
  • A vibrant and modern working environment, supporting employees’ wellbeing:
  • Subsidized company restaurant;
  • On-site vibrant Café for breaks and less formal meetings;
  • On-site fitness room and possibility to join regular group sport activities;
  • Flexibility in terms of working hours;
  • Employee Assistance Program: free professional counseling services, work-life resources, and mental health support.
  • Supporting employee's commute: plenty of parking facilities for both cars and bikes, shower facilities, shuttle between Heizel metro and the office, carpooling community.

ARE YOU EXCITED ABOUT THE ROLE? DEEP DIVE INTO P&G AND CHECK THE BELOW INSIGHTFUL LINKS:

  • Our hiring process consists of three main steps: 1) application, 2) online assessments and 3) interviews. Click here to get all the tips to be fully prepared.
  • P&G is driven to make life better, not just within the company, but across the globe. Click here to check out how we make a meaningful impact on the world.
  • We are the world’s largest consumer goods company. Click here to discover about our iconic brands.

At P&G #weseeequal

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. At P&G we strive to build a culture where everyone feels welcome, included, and able to bring their full selves to work.

We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process. Please click here if you require an accommodation during the application process. Please make sure to wait to hear back from us regarding your accommodation before proceeding with the online assessment, we thank you in advance for your patience.

Title: Mobile Application Developer
Description:
As a Lead Mobile App Developer, you will oversee the creation of advanced mobile applications for Android and iOS platforms. You will manage cross-functional teams, convert strategic objectives into technical implementations, and ensure the delivery of high-quality, scalable, and high-performing mobile solutions.




Responsibilities:

Lead and mentor development teams, fostering technical growth and innovation.

Design and deliver mobile solutions that are customer-focused and built to scale.
Uphold quality standards through code reviews, testing, and implementation of best practices.
Collaborate with stakeholders, product managers, and designers to translate user requirements into functional apps.
Stay ahead of industry trends and integrate emerging technologies into development processes.
Streamline CI/CD pipelines for efficient and error-free app releases.
Diagnose and resolve complex technical challenges.




Ideal Candidate:

10+ years of hands-on experience in native mobile app development with expertise in Android and iOS platforms.
Strong grasp of mobile architectural patterns (e.g., MVC, MVVM, Clean Architecture).
Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, Firebase) and API integrations.
Proficient in programming languages like Kotlin and Swift; experience with frameworks such as Flutter, React Native, or Ionic is an advantage.
Proven leadership in managing and mentoring development teams.
Excellent interpersonal and collaboration skills.
A passion for tackling challenges and driving innovation.




The Offer:

Hybrid working in Brussels
Long-term contract
Day Rate flexible




Could this project interest you? If so, apply now!

  • 10+ years of hands-on experience in native mobile app development with expertise in Android and iOS platforms.
  • Strong grasp of mobile architectural patterns (e.g., MVC, MVVM, Clean Architecture).
  • Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, Firebase) and API integrations.
  • Proficient in programming languages like Kotlin and Swift; experience with frameworks such as Flutter, React Native, or Ionic is an advantage.
  • Proven leadership in managing and mentoring development teams.
  • Excellent interpersonal and collaboration skills.
  • A passion for tackling challenges and driving innovation.


The Offer:

  • Hybrid working in Brussels
  • Long-term contract
  • Day Rate flexible


Could this project interest you? If so, apply now!

Title: Application Developer
Description:
Role:- Application Developer

Language:-French and English

Location: Sint-Gillis, Belgium

Work mode: hybrid

Duration: 03/02/2025 - 03/08/2025




Job Description

As a Senior Windev developer, you will join a Scrum team responsible for the development and maintenance of human resources applications for various Social Security institutions (eHR project).




Depending on the priorities established by the project manager, you will ensure the development in Windev of certain functionalities and take charge of the testing of functionalities written by other developers.

You will take part in the operational monitoring of applications and in maintenance or troubleshooting interventions for customers.

Finally, you will make an active contribution to team brainstorming sessions related to the development architecture of new modules.

PROFILE

With a master's degree in computer science or equivalent, you have extensive professional experience in the development of management applications (in procedural and object mode).

You have knowledge of relational databases and the SQL language, as well as knowledge of the Windev language.

Curious and passionate about new technologies, you are able to put your experience at the service of a project and work autonomously, methodically, and set your priorities. You like teamwork and knowledge sharing.

With good communication skills, you are able to put yourself in the shoes of a user when it comes to developing a process.

Finally, you have a passive knowledge of Dutch.

Skills




Relational Databases

Software Development

SQL

Windev

Title: SRE Engineer
Description:
Job Description

SRE Engineer

This is Worldline.

Worldline helps businesses of all shapes and sizes to accelerate their growth journey - quickly, simply, and securely. We are the innovators at the heart of the payments technology industry, shaping how the world pays and gets paid. Our technology powers the growth of millions of businesses across 5 continents. And just as we help our customers accelerate their business, we are committed to helping our people accelerate their careers. Together, we shape the evolution.

The Opportunity

Worldline is looking for an experienced SRE to reinforce his infrastructure team in Brussels.

Day-to-Day Responsibilities

Infrastructures services are managed by multiple teams, you will join one of these teams with today's focus on:


Building and scaling our virtualization stack on VMware
Scaling and automating the Block storage for our datacenters based on SAN technology
Making sure the backup strategy is covering all needed assists and the internal clients can consume it
Driving the Hardware management so we scale up in time and stay cost efficient, be the reference point for the hands-on teams in the datacenter.
Making sure the NTP service is up and can be consumed by all platforms as this is a business critical service.
Building and scaling the HSM service for all payment platform
Taking part in the IAM automation


Who Are We Looking For

We look for big thinkers. People who can drive positive change, step up and show what’s next – people with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. In practice this means:


Academic or Bachelor level of education or equivalent by experience
Strong Linux experience in a HA environment
Self-starter, autonomous
Ability to engage with both technical and non-technical staff at all levels in the organisation
Quick learner
Ability to make your way through a complicate stack autonomously
Automation is your answer to (almost) everything
Open source enthusiast (but not only)
Believe in Infrastructure as Code
Target 0 support solution and self healing systems
Security minded


Ability To Find Trade Of In


stability vs. agility,
operational work vs. software engineering,
proactive vs. reactive work


Your Favorite Books Are


https://landing.google.com/sre/sre-book/toc/index.html
https://learning.oreilly.com/library/view/infrastructure-as-code/9781098114664/


Must Have


Excellent knowledge of virtualization technologies like VMware, Proxmox, Nutanix, HyperV, Openstack etc; Storage; Hardware; Backup; NTP
Used to work with source version control like Git, GitLab, GIT flows and CICD
Used to work with Puppet (we do almost-everything with puppet)
Used to work with Terraform (we aim that all pieces of infra is defined with code)
Excellent knowledge of Scripting (powershell / puppet / CICD ./ Python / GO / JASON / HIERA)
Understanding of network protocol (IP, DHCP, DNS, BGP, Load balancing,...)
Experience with multi DC setup and large Vmware clusters (in different countries)
Experience with hybrid infra (On prem + cloud)
Experience with AWS (Workspace, ) and Azure
Experience with security standards (PCI-DSS,...)
Focus on automation


Nice to have


Experience with ELK
Knowledge of GO
Docker, Kubernetes
Familiar with service discovery in a micro-frontend architecture
Used to work with Windows and Linux servers
Excellent communication skills in English
Good knowledge of Dutch and/or French are a plus


Shape the evolution.

We are pushing towards the next frontiers of payments technology, and we look for big thinkers to join our journey. People with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. Here you’ll work with ambitious colleagues from around the world, take on unique challenges as a team, and make a real impact on the society. And with our empowering culture, strong technology and extensive training opportunities, we help you accelerate your career. Wherever you decide to go. Join our global team of over 18,000 innovators across 40+ countries, and shape a tomorrow that is yours to own.

Learn more about life at Worldline at jobs.worldline.com

We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as an individual with a disability, or any applicable legally protected characteristics.

Title: Full-Stack Developer
Description:
We're working with an established SaaS company based in Brussels who are aiming to revolutionize the FinTech Industry in 2025 and have just received substantial investment to help them do so.




They're looking to expand their team with a passionate and talented Full-Stack Developer who is keen on career progression and has strong experience with Angular and Node.js.




Responsibilities:

Build/maintain user-friendly web applications using Angular.
Design/implement server-side solutions with Node.js.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to improve and create new features.
Optimize performance, ensuring integration between front and back-end.
Write clean and well-documented code.
Participate in code reviews and future interview processes.




Your Profile:

Proven experience as a Full-Stack Developer with a strong focus on Angular/Node.js.
Familiarity with Java and its ecosystem is a plus.
Fluency in Dutch is preferred, with English proficiency as a strong advantage.
A keen interest in the FinTech space.
Strong analytical skills and the ability to tackle complex technical challenges.
Excellent communication skills to cope with a fast-paced environment.




Offer:

The opportunity to be part of an established and continuously growing SaaS company.
Joining a culture that actively encourages development and taking responsibility.
Competitive salary (€3,500-€6,000).
Full benefits package including company car.
Up to 32 days holiday on offer.
3 days remote working per week.
Working in a brand new office in Brussels.




If you're experienced in Angular and Node and share a passion for the FinTech industry, apply today!

Title: Test Engineer
Description:
Permanent position only

WHAT CREAM IS ALL ABOUT?

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency…but in reality, we are a consulting company in Business & Technology active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport sectors.

CREAM’S SPECIAL RECIPE:

1/3 of Personal development
1/3 of Collective Intelligence
1/3 of Intrapreneurship

And Bonus ingredient: … Some passionate colleagues :-)

WHAT IS A TEST ENGINEER AT CREAM ?

As a Test Engineer, you will work in close collaboration with analysts and developers in order to run projects related to:

Front end and back end applications
Mobile and tablet applications for the end users
Websites and e-commerce solutions
Deployment of automated systems




YOUR TASKS :

Validation and probation of the functional and technical specifications
Design test plan: procedures, scenarios, components
Organize and execute tests
Follow-up internal development phases in collaboration with the project manager
Test evaluation through the anomalies follow-up and test cover
Provide support during the validation phase before deployment: users acceptance testing and functional testing




HOW DO WE IMAGINE OUR FUTURE CONSULTANT?

You have a University Degree in the Information Technologies field (Civil Engineer, Master in Computer Sciences, or related fields)
At least 2 years of experience in software testing
You have a proven experience in structured testing as a System Tester for IT projects
Very good knowledge of testing tools and methodologies among others:
Experience with HP QC, HP ALM or QTP
Knowledge of UML modelling and Use Cases writing
You have the ability to communicate easily on technical subjects with developers
You are fluent in French and English, a good knowledge of Dutch is also required

Bonus

A training or a certification in ISTQB would be a real asset
Knowledge in TFS and XMLA training or a certification in ISTQB would be a real asset




WHY SHOULD YOU TASTE THE LIME FLAVOR?

A broad diversity of career options: you’re not stuck in a box
You evolve in a learning environment where you can challenge your knowledge with your colleagues
You grow in a company that is at the leading edge of technology
You have the opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving company
We have values we share, live with, experiment every day

We just hire great people and give them the playing field to become awesome!




"THE LITTLE THING THAT CAN MAKE THE DIFFERENCE : CREAM IS DEVELOPING A DIVERSITY PLAN AND WOULD LIKE THAT ALL ITS MEMBERS REFLECT THE SOCIETY IN ALL ITS DIVERSITY"

Title: Software Engineer NVISO LABS
Description:
Who are we?

It all starts with the mission: NVISO is here to protect European society from potentially devastating cyber attacks! This means we offer cyber security services to private and governmental organizations to help them better prepare for, prevent, detect and respond to cyber security incidents.

All of this is built on four fundamental values that define who we are: We are Proud, We Break Barriers, We Care and No BS!

Tasks

As a Software Engineer, you will be involved in a variety of projects in the NVISO Labs team. Your responsibilities will include:


Designing & developing software using mainly Python.
Leveraging Azure Cloud functionality, such as PowerApps and Serverless Functions.
Bridging gaps between complex back-end structures and user-friendly front-end interfaces.
Utilizing advanced programming skills and experience with application development to ensure the success of projects.
Demonstrating excellent troubleshooting skills to maintain and improve system performance.
Identifying bottlenecks and improving software efficiency.



Requirements


Eligible for NATO CLEARANCE (see HERE for more information).
Minimum of 2-3 years of experience as a Software Engineer, with a focus on backend (e.g. services, infrastructure, and architecture).
A master's degree in computer science or a related technical field.
Strong experience in Python.
Passionate about SDLC best practices regarding reusability, maintainability, security and testing.
Comprehensive understanding of computer systems beyond application development (including operating systems, networking, infrastructure, etc.).
Excellent English level (oral & written).
Strong interpersonal communication skills (oral & written) that enable effective work in a collaborative team environment (across the entire company).



Benefits

At NVISO, we care. We are committed to offering you a highly competitive remuneration package including financial and non-financial components:


A training budget of 10.000€ and 10 days every two years
Company car + Belgian fuel card
Working and learning from the best people in the European cyber security industry. We have multiple SANS Instructors working at NVISO, our staff has presented at popular hacking conferences (BlackHat, BruCON, OWASP, etc) and all of our technical staff can acquire deep technical security certifications (GSE, GXPN, GREM, GCFA, OSCP, etc)
An entrepreneurial and agile company, where you will be stimulated and supported in driving new initiatives (either through internal innovation or by improving our service offering), without losing sight of having fun!
Regular team-building and fun events with legendary off-site events once a year. The location of the next team building is one of the most closely guarded secrets at NVISO… We can however disclose that we’ve visited Lisbon, Dubai and Malta over the past few years
Our commitment to coach and counsel you and help you grow; each employee receives a personal coach within the team, whose role is to ensure your well-being and helps you grow in your career!
Flexible working hours and home office possibilities
Flex Reward Plan
32 holidays



IF YOU’RE INTERESTED, PLEASE SEND US YOUR APPLICATION!

WE’RE LOOKING FORWARD TO MEETING YOU!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We are looking for a talented Data Scientist to join our client in the Zurich area.




In this role, you will work as part of an international team and contribute to the development of an innovative product.




If you possess a degree in a related field, have substantial experience in data science, a solid understanding of statistics, and strong Python skills, we encourage you to apply!




Fluency in German is a huge advantage.

Experience with SQL, Spark and MLOps is a plus.




Apply today directly to bojana.bandovic@nicollcurtin.com!

Title: Machine Learning Scientist
Description:
At lastminute.com, we live for the holidays. We are the European Travel-Tech leader in Dynamic Holiday Packages. With technology, we turn spontaneous thoughts into meaningful experiences, helping people travel the world.



We are looking for a Machine Learning Scientist to join our team of around 1,700 people worldwide to help us power up the travelers' journey for millions of h olidaymakers. If you are a motivated machine learning scientist who loves to work with challenging real-world problems on big data, keep reading, as you might be the perfect fit for this job.





Job Description



Job Title - Machine Learning Scientist
Working model - hybrid at Chiasso office
Team - You will join the Strategic Analytics team in the Technology department.
Level - Professional
Location - Chiasso, Switzerland
Contract - Permanent - full-time (36 h/week)



What your impact will be:



Develop real-time machine learning solutions to deal with challenging real-world problems on big data
Develop Ranking Algorithms based on deep learning
Collaborate in a cross-functional team, including machine learning scientists, software engineers, machine learning engineers, and project managers


Qualifications



Your expertise:



A Ph.D. in Computer Science, Mathematics, or Physics, or a Master's degree with a minimum of 3 years of experience in machine learning.
Excellent knowledge of Supervised methods (Classification, Regression) and Unsupervised methods (Clustering, Feature Selection, Dimensionality Reduction)
Good knowledge of Python and SQL, with knowledge of the most important Python libraries for Machine Learning and Data Analysis (scikit-learn, Pandas, matplotlib, Numpy, Scipy, MLflow)
Experience with Deep Learning (Recurrent Neural Networks, Convolutional Neural Networks, and Autoencoders)
Experience with Keras (and TensorFlow) or PyTorch

Desirable:



Experience in Uncertainty Estimation (Monte Carlo Dropout, Deep Ensembles)
Able to find creative solutions to interesting problems
Curious with a constant desire to learn and collaborate


Additional Information



Perks of working with us:



How we work together:
- An inclusive, friendly, and international environment (you’ll be working with colleagues from +10 countries and over 48 nationalities)
- Shorter working week, with a half working day on Fridays
- Flexible start and end of the working day
- Possibility to work from anywhere for a period of time per year defined according to local regulations



How we learn together:
- Fri-Yays: half a day on Friday morning with a no-meeting mandate and dedicated to deep work, personal growth, learning and training and/or focus time.
- Professional and managerial skills development training paths, access to e-learning platforms such as O'Reilly, Udemy, Coursera (depending on the department), and to our internal platform offering bespoke training content



Other perks:
- 2 paid days off per year for volunteering purposes
- Occasional social events to foster connections among colleagues
- Travel industry discounts and flash exclusive staff fares
- We support our employees through life's significant moments with leave options (e.g parental responsibilities, marriages, bereavements, relocations, etc.) in line with local laws.



Wish you were here? We do, too!







Selection process steps*:



- HR interview (30 minutes)
- 1st interview (Manager 1 hour): Machine learning + Python coding
- 2nd interview (Director 45 min): Soft skills + machine learning knowledge
- Offer extended
(*Please note the process can slightly vary. The recruiter in charge will share more details when setting up the interview)







Our commitment to celebrate diversity and generate belonging



At the heart of our culture is a commitment to inclusion across race, gender, age, sexual orientation, religion, gender identity or expression, and accessibility. We strongly believe in an equal opportunity space, which is welcoming and celebrates the uniqueness of everyone who works here. We value different lived experiences and respect viewpoints, as we know unicity drives innovation. We want to make sure our people reflect the communities across the world we help travel.



Eligibility criteria:
By submitting your information and application, you confirm that you are legally authorised to work in the country of employment and that you do not require visa sponsorship to obtain employment visa status.







Please submit your resume in English
Please submit your resume in English



Show more
HTML:
At lastminute.com, we live for the holidays. We are the European Travel-Tech leader in Dynamic Holiday Packages. With technology, we turn spontaneous thoughts into meaningful experiences, helping people travel the world.

We are looking for a Machine Learning Scientist to join our team of around 1,700 people worldwide to help us power up the travelers' journey for millions of h olidaymakers. If you are a motivated machine learning scientist who loves to work with challenging real-world problems on big data, keep reading, as you might be the perfect fit for this job.



Job Description

Job Title - Machine Learning Scientist
Working model - hybrid at Chiasso office
Team - You will join the Strategic Analytics team in the Technology department.
Level - Professional
Location - Chiasso, Switzerland
Contract - Permanent - full-time (36 h/week)

What your impact will be:

  • Develop real-time machine learning solutions to deal with challenging real-world problems on big data
  • Develop Ranking Algorithms based on deep learning
  • Collaborate in a cross-functional team, including machine learning scientists, software engineers, machine learning engineers, and project managers

Qualifications

Your expertise:

  • A Ph.D. in Computer Science, Mathematics, or Physics, or a Master's degree with a minimum of 3 years of experience in machine learning.
  • Excellent knowledge of Supervised methods (Classification, Regression) and Unsupervised methods (Clustering, Feature Selection, Dimensionality Reduction)
  • Good knowledge of Python and SQL, with knowledge of the most important Python libraries for Machine Learning and Data Analysis (scikit-learn, Pandas, matplotlib, Numpy, Scipy, MLflow)
  • Experience with Deep Learning (Recurrent Neural Networks, Convolutional Neural Networks, and Autoencoders)
  • Experience with Keras (and TensorFlow) or PyTorch

Desirable:

  • Experience in Uncertainty Estimation (Monte Carlo Dropout, Deep Ensembles)
  • Able to find creative solutions to interesting problems
  • Curious with a constant desire to learn and collaborate

Additional Information

Perks of working with us:

How we work together:
- An inclusive, friendly, and international environment (you’ll be working with colleagues from +10 countries and over 48 nationalities)
- Shorter working week, with a half working day on Fridays
- Flexible start and end of the working day
- Possibility to work from anywhere for a period of time per year defined according to local regulations

How we learn together:
- Fri-Yays: half a day on Friday morning with a no-meeting mandate and dedicated to deep work, personal growth, learning and training and/or focus time.
- Professional and managerial skills development training paths, access to e-learning platforms such as O'Reilly, Udemy, Coursera (depending on the department), and to our internal platform offering bespoke training content

Other perks:
- 2 paid days off per year for volunteering purposes
- Occasional social events to foster connections among colleagues
- Travel industry discounts and flash exclusive staff fares
- We support our employees through life's significant moments with leave options (e.g parental responsibilities, marriages, bereavements, relocations, etc.) in line with local laws.

Wish you were here? We do, too!



Selection process steps*:

- HR interview (30 minutes)
- 1st interview (Manager 1 hour): Machine learning + Python coding
- 2nd interview (Director 45 min): Soft skills + machine learning knowledge
- Offer extended
(*Please note the process can slightly vary. The recruiter in charge will share more details when setting up the interview)



Our commitment to celebrate diversity and generate belonging

At the heart of our culture is a commitment to inclusion across race, gender, age, sexual orientation, religion, gender identity or expression, and accessibility. We strongly believe in an equal opportunity space, which is welcoming and celebrates the uniqueness of everyone who works here. We value different lived experiences and respect viewpoints, as we know unicity drives innovation. We want to make sure our people reflect the communities across the world we help travel.

Title: Data Scientist, Energy Analytics
Description:
Minimum qualifications:


Master's degree in Statistics, Data Science, Mathematics, Physics, Economics, Operations Research, Engineering, a related quantitative field, or equivalent practical experience.
3 years of work experience using analytics to solve product or business problems, coding (e.g., Python, R, SQL), querying databases or statistical analysis, or a PhD degree.


Preferred qualifications:


PhD in Statistics, Engineering, Physics, Mathematics, or a related field.
5 years of work experience using analytics to solve product or business problems, coding (e.g., Python, R, SQL), querying databases or statistical analysis, or a PhD degree.
Experience in working or internship as an energy analyst, trader, system operator, etc., including experience applying advanced analytics to energy systems’ planning, control and learning problems within universities, national labs, electric utility companies.
Experience with the energy system data.
Experience with optimization (e.g., cvx, Gurobi), statistical (e.g., R, Python) software, and database languages (e.g., SQL).


About The Job

As a Data Scientist, you will collaborate with Google’s Climate Operations team, Energy and Policy Strategists, Engineers and Product Managers to adjust Google's energy systems and practices based on your findings. You will apply an understanding of energy systems and market dynamics, optimization and statistical knowledge, as well as the coding experience, to develop methods to solve and assess the problems related to carbon and efficiency aware compute shifting, grid integration, energy asset forecasting and scalable control. You will work broadly with different energy stakeholders across the organization and drive innovation of our energy systems stack, while improving its efficiency and global environmental impact.

Responsibilities


Lead projects with energy system, market analysis and carbon impact analysis, modeling, drawing from multiple problem solving methods and energy domain expertise to choose the right tool and right level of complexity appropriate for the business challenges.
Engage broadly with the organization to identify, prioritize, frame, and structure and ambiguous challenges arising in the energy domain, where advanced projects or tools can have the impact.
Identify and communicate the challenges and opportunities that the group should be working on.
Articulate business questions and use techniques to arrive at an answer using data. Translate analysis results into business recommendations.
Help define the problem solving direction and influence the direction of the associated engineering and infrastructure work.



Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

Title: Junior Data Scientist (Tech)
HTML:
Job Description

A Pagaleve é uma empresa do setor de “Buy Now Pay Later”, uma startup fintech inovadora e uma das primeiras empresas a oferecer pagamento parcelado no PIX, sem juros, e sem a necessidade de usar cartão de crédito. Temos como objetivo oferecer a lojistas um novo método de pagamento, para aumentar suas vendas de um jeito simples, descomplicado e ágil, mas também temos como objetivo oferecer às pessoas a oportunidade de comprar aquilo que desejam, sem se comprometerem com os altos juros do cartão de crédito.

Responsibilities and assignments

Venha fazer parte do time de Tecnologia e crescer exponencialmente junto com a gente!

Responsabilidades e Atribuições

  • Apoiar os times Seniors na definição e implementação da estratégia de ciência de dados para o negócio;
  • Usar big data para desenvolver modelos de Inteligência Artificial;
  • Pesquisar e explorar novas metodologias para serem utilizada nos modelos de Inteligência Artificial;
  • Fornecer insights para os negócios (Crédito, Produto, Operações, Finanças);
  • Trabalhar em colaboração com as equipes de engenharia de dados e plataformas para melhorar e aprimorar ainda mais a plataforma de dados da Pagaleve;
  • Trabalhar em colaboração com as equipes de Analytics para melhorar e aprimorar as estratégias de dados aplicadas na Pagaleve;

Requirements And Qualifications

Requisitos e Qualificações:

  • Experiência em linguagem de programação de Dados (Python, SQL);
  • Conhecimento em modelagem estatística;
  • Análise estatística e machine learning;
  • Habilidade de comunicação com times técnicos e não-técnicos;
  • Inglês básico.

﻿

Diferenciais

  • Conhecimento em plataformas de Big Data (Spark, Snowflake, AWS Glue AWS EMR,);
  • Conhecimento em pacotes de funções de Machine Learning e visualizações(Scikit, AWS Personalize,Tensorflow, Pycaret, seaborn, etc);
  • Conhecimento em AWS Sagemaker ou plataformas de machine learning semelhantes;
  • Conhecimento em Cloud (AWS e/ou GCP);
  • Conhecimento em ferramentas de gerenciamento de código (Git);
  • Conhecimento básico em engenharia de dados;
  • Inglês avançado.

Additional information

  • Modelo de contratação PJ;
  • Remuneração competitiva;
  • Pensando no seu bem-estar e no de toda sua família, oferecemos plano de saúde com cobertura 100% do titular e 75% para o primeiro dependente;
  • Convênio Odontológico;
  • Cupom de desconto mensal nas lojas que aceitam o Pix Parcelado;
  • Day off no dia do seu aniversário;
  • Ajuda de custo (cartão caju);
  • Modelo flexível de trabalho, pois atuamos no modelo híbrido (presencial 1 - 2x por semana), escritório na Vila Olímpia, SP.

Process stages

  • Step 1: Registration1Registration
  • Step 2: Entrevista com RH2Entrevista com RH
  • Step 3: Entrevista com o Gestor3Entrevista com o Gestor
  • Step 4: Hiring4Hiring

Conheça Mais Sobre a Pagaleve

Agradecemos seu interesse em fazer parte da Pagaleve.

Nossos processos seletivos estão acontecendo de maneira remota.

Torcemos para que você esteja bem, com saúde e seguro.

A Pagaleve é uma empresa do setor de “Buy

Now Pay Later”. Somos uma das primeiras empresas a oferecer pagamento parcelado

no PIX, sem juros, e sem a necessidade de usar cartão de crédito. Temos como

objetivo oferecer aos lojistas um novo método de pagamento, para aumentar suas

vendas de um jeito simples, descomplicado e ágil, mas também temos como

objetivo oferecer às pessoas a oportunidade de comprar aquilo que desejam, sem

se comprometerem com os altos juros do cartão de crédito.

Propósito

Democratizar o acesso ao parcelamento e pagamentos, libertando consumidores e varejistas do sistema

financeiro tradicional, com tecnologia inovadora e uma relação financeira leve e saudável.

Visão

Ser o sinônimo de parcelamento para milhões de consumidores e o parceiro preferido dos varejistas na América Latina.

Title: CIENTISTA DE DADOS SÊNIOR
HTML:
Quer fazer parte da nossa turma?

São mais 30 anos recheados de aprendizados e doces conquistas. A Cultura vivenciada na empresa traduz a essência de quem somos e onde queremos chegar.

Vivemos para Juntos tocar a vida das pessoas compartilhando momentos especiais.

Ingredientes como Foco, Atitude, União, Alegria e muita Paixão por realizar nos impulsiona a fazer sempre o melhor, transformando o Ordinário em Extraordinário.

A nossa turma é formada por pessoas que fazem da Cacau show um lugar especial para se trabalhar, onde todos são tratados com igualdade, independentemente de gênero, raça, idade, origem ou orientação sexual, sendo nosso processo baseado em meritocracia.

Na Cacau todos são Show!!!

Se você é apaixonado pelo que faz, possui senso de dono e muito “gás” para trabalhar, essa vaga é a sua cara!!!

Responsabilidades e atribuições

  • Identificar problemas de negócio que podem ser resolvidos com ciência de dados;
  • Desenvolver e implementar estratégias de ciência de dados alinhadas aos objetivos da empresa;
  • Realizar estudos de viabilidade para novos projetos e propor soluções inovadoras;
  • Liderar o processo de coleta, limpeza, enriquecimento e transformação de dados provenientes de diferentes fontes;
  • Garantir a qualidade, integridade e governança dos dados utilizados nos projetos;
  • Projetar e desenvolver pipelines de dados para ETL/ELT;
  • Realizar análises exploratórias (EDA) e identificar padrões e tendências relevantes;
  • Construir, treinar e validar modelos preditivos e prescritivos (ex.: regressão, classificação, clustering);
  • Implementar algoritmos de machine learning e/ou deep learning;
  • Avaliar e otimizar modelos para garantir alta acurácia, precisão e performance;
  • Desenvolver provas de conceito (POCs) para validar hipóteses e modelos;
  • Conduzir projetos end-to-end: desde o levantamento de problemas e coleta de dados até a entrega de soluções;
  • Liderar equipes técnicas


Requisitos e qualificações

Graduação em Ciência de Dados, Engenharia de Computação, Estatística, Matemática Aplicada, Engenharia de Software ou áreas correlatas. Desejável pós-graduação ou MBA em áreas como Big Data, Inteligência Artificial ou Engenharia de Dados.

CONHECIMENTOS E EXPERIÊNCIA:

  • Expertise em modelagem preditiva, machine learning e deep learning;
  • Técnicas estatísticas avançadas: regressão, clustering, redução de dimensionalidade, etc.
  • Domínio de Python e/ou R;
  • Conhecimento em bibliotecas e frameworks como Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch, Pandas, NumPy, etc;
  • Experiência em SQL para manipulação de dados estruturados;
  • Experiência com ferramentas de Big Data como Spark, Hadoop ou Kafka;
  • Familiaridade com APIs e integração de sistemas;
  • Conhecimento de serviços de nuvem como AWS, Azure, ou Google Cloud;
  • Experiência com ferramentas de versionamento de código (ex.: Git) e processos de CI/CD;
  • Manipulação de dados e visualização de dados;
  • Experiência com ETL, limpeza, e transformação de dados;
  • Conhecimento em bancos de dados relacionais (ex.: MySQL, PostgreSQL) e NoSQL (ex.: MongoDB, Cassandra);
  • Conhecimento em ferramentas como Tableau, Power BI ou bibliotecas como Matplotlib e Seaborn


DIFERENCIAL:

  • Certificações em Ciência de Dados ou Nuvem (ex.: AWS Certified Machine Learning Specialist, Azure Data Scientist Associate);
  • Experiência em projetos que envolvam IA Generativa, NLP ou Visão Computacional;
  • Conhecimento de metodologias ágeis (ex.: Scrum, Kanban)


Informações adicionais

  • Assistência Médica;
  • Assistência Odontológica;
  • Seguro de Vida;
  • Vale transporte/Fretado ou Estacionamento na empresa;
  • Cesta Básica ou Vale alimentação;
  • Restaurante na empresa;
  • Academia e Salão de Beleza na empresa;
  • Desconto nos produtos Cacau Show (Matriz).

Title: Cientista de Dados Júnior (Vaga afirmativa para Mulheres)
HTML:
Job Description

O que faz a área na Porto?

﻿A área de Ciência de Dados da Porto apoia as demais áreas do Sinistro Automóvel para entregar um serviço que supere as expectativas dos nossos clientes e parceiros. Nosso objetivo é fornecer análises e modelos assertivos para guiar corretamente as decisões de simplificar, flexibilizar e reduzir custo de operação sem prejudicar a excelência dos nossos serviços.

Responsibilities and assignments

  • Planejar, desenvolver e manter modelos de machine learning;
  • Realizar processo de ETL (extração, transformação e validação) de dados para o desenvolvimento de análises;
  • Participar do processo de validação e implementação dos modelos desenvolvidos.


Requirements And Qualifications

Escolaridade: Graduação completa ou cursando em estatística, engenharias, economia, matemática aplicada, ciência da computação ou áreas correlatas;

Experiência: Experiência com análise exploratória de dados; experiência com modelos de machine learning (supervisionados e não supervisionados); experiência em Python ou R.

Skills técnicos:

  • Habilidade para desenvolver e revisar códigos com a linguagem de programação;
  • Conhecimento técnico e teórico sobre ML e estatística;


Skills comportamentais:

  • Habilidade para trabalhar com equipes diversas;
  • Comunicação empática (conseguir discutir questões técnicas com pessoas técnicas e não técnicas de maneira assertiva e inclusiva);
  • Comprometimento com o aprendizado contínuo;
  • Desejo em atingir altos padrões no desenvolvimento de soluções.


Serão Diferenciais:

  • Experiência com modelagem em casos reais;
  • Experiência com linguagem SQL ou SAS;
  • Conhecimento em computação em nuvem;
  • Conhecimento em ferramentas de visualização de dados (PowerBI, Tableau, etc).


Additional information

Nossos benefícios:

Vale Alimentação e Refeição: Seu VR e VA são flexíveis, para que você atenda às suas necessidades e defina a melhor maneira de utilizá-los;

Vale-Transporte: Para nos encontrarmos na Porto;

Serviços de Transporte: Para o seu conforto e segurança no trajeto até o nosso escritório, disponibilizamos vans nas principais estações de acesso à Porto: Luz, Barra Funda, Santa Cecília e Júlio Prestes;

Plano de Saúde, Odontológico e Seguro de Vida: Para que você possa se cuidar, e também cuidar de seus dependentes;

Participação nos Lucros - PLR: Pois sabemos que só vamos crescer, se crescermos juntos;

Porto em Ação: Programa complementar à PLR, disponibilizando anualmente, até 2025, uma porcentagem de valor do seu salário em ações da Porto;

Pais, mães e filhos: Auxílio creche ou babá, para cuidar do seu bem mais precioso;

Previdência Privada - PortoPrev: Para você garantir um futuro mais tranquilo;

Gympass: Para você possa se exercitar e cuidar da sua saúde física em diversas academias, onde estiver;

Bolsa de estudos; Para você começar uma graduação ou que sonha em fazer uma segunda faculdade ou pós-graduação;

Cursos de Idiomas: Subsídio para cursos de Inglês e Espanhol;

Programa Saúde Integral: Série de benefícios e iniciativas para te apoiar a encontrar equilíbrio de forma integral, através de três pilares: saúde mental, saúde física e saúde financeira;

Desconto em Produtos e Serviços: Para que você possa desfrutar dos produtos e serviços deste nosso ecossistema gigante;

Local e modelo de trabalho: Centro de SP | Híbrido (1 à 2x por semana no escritório).

Process stages

  • Step 1: Registration1Registration
  • Step 2: Triagem2Triagem
  • Step 3: Entrevista RH e Gestor3Entrevista RH e Gestor
  • Step 4: Case4Case
  • Step 5: Hiring5Hiring


Na Porto, Você Importa!

A Porto é muito mais que uma seguradora: é um ecossistema gigante que utiliza tecnologia para criar soluções, através de quatro verticais de negócio: Porto Bank, Porto Saúde, Porto Seguro e Porto Serviço. A reputação e o reconhecimento conquistados ao longo de mais de 7 décadas reforçam o tamanho da Porto, uma empresa referência em negócios, feita para e por pessoas.

Aqui, bate no peito de 13 mil colaboradores o orgulho de fazer parte de uma organização sólida e ética, que transforma sonhos em realidades fantásticas para os nossos mais de 15,8 milhões de clientes. São mais de 101 sucursais e escritórios regionais em todo o Brasil.

O aprendizado faz parte do nosso DNA, e aqui, você terá incentivos, ferramentas e gente boa para você aprender e crescer, a cada dia, um ambiente de acolhimento e segurança, onde cada um possa ser e se orgulhar de quem se é, promovendo um espaço de respeito e vivendo de forma integral e com bem-estar, em uma empresa genuinamente humana.

DIVERSIDADE & INCLUSÃO NA PORTO

Aqui na Porto, valorizamos a diversidade e acreditamos que um time plural é imprescindível para o desenvolvimento de todo o nosso negócio, da sociedade, e de cada pessoa, pois entendemos que cada indivíduo é único na construção de um ambiente mais inovador e inclusivo. Juntos, trabalhamos diariamente para construirmos um espaço seguro, livre e acolhedor, com mais pluralidade e respeito. Por isso, incentivamos fortemente a inscrição de mulheres, de pessoas negras e indígenas, de pessoas com deficiência e de pessoas LGBTQIA+ em todas as nossas vagas.

Title: Cientista de Dados (Marketing)
Description:
A Volkswagen Group Services tem como objetivo prestar serviços específicos às empresas do Grupo VW, garantindo a excelência em nossas entregas e mantendo o foco nas necessidades estratégicas de cada cliente.

Em 2023 iniciamos nossa operação na América do Sul e estamos em busca de profissionais talentosos e engajados que queiram embarcar nessa jornada conosco.

Responsabilidades e atribuições

Responsável por realizar análises, exploração, consolidação e tradução de dados, com o objetivo de gerar insights estratégicos para campanhas de produto, varejo, lançamento e performance, com foco na conversão de vendas, considerando a jornada híbrida dos clientes (on e offline).

Principais tarefas:


Coletar e processar dados de diferentes fontes (Data Lake, Google Cloud, Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, Sales Force, etc) e realizar análises estatísticas e exploratórias em grandes conjuntos de dados para identificar padrões, tendências e insights relevantes.
Criar, treinar e otimizar modelos preditivos de machine learning e algoritmos para prever comportamentos futuros e auxiliar na tomada de decisões estratégicas.
Desenvolver dashboards, gráficos e relatórios claros para comunicar os resultados das análises para stakeholders, facilitando a compreensão dos insights extraídos.
Garantir a qualidade dos dados, realizando processos de tratamento, normalização e transformação dos dados brutos.
Trabalhar em conjunto com outros departamentos, como marketing, digitalização, TI e vendas, para compreender as necessidades do negócio e propor soluções baseadas em dados.
Acompanhar as novas tecnologias, ferramentas e técnicas na área de ciência de dados para aplicar melhores práticas no trabalho.



Requisitos e qualificações

Requisitos:


Formação superior completa em Ciência de Dados, Estatística, Matemática, Engenharia, Computação ou áreas correlatas.
Inglês intermediário / avançado.
Conhecimento em linguagens como Python, R, SQL e uso de bibliotecas de machine learning.
Capacidade de aplicar conceitos estatísticos para a análise de dados e criação de modelos.
Uso de ferramentas como Tableau/Power BI para a criação de visualizações de dados.
Capacidade de abordar problemas complexos de forma lógica e propor soluções baseadas em dados.
Desenvolvimento e validação de modelos, incluindo regressão, classificação, clustering, entre outros.
Habilidade de explicar conceitos técnicos de forma compreensível para pessoas sem formação técnica.



Desejável:


Vivência comprovada em funções similares.



Informações adicionais

Trata-se de uma oportunidade CLT, no formato híbrido, com presença necessária em nossos escritórios, nos bairros do Jabaquara e Morumbi, ou em Agências de Publicidade em SP, ou ainda, em São Bernardo do Campo, 3 vezes por semana.
Show more

Responsável por realizar análises, exploração, consolidação e tradução de dados, com o objetivo de gerar insights estratégicos para campanhas de produto, varejo, lançamento e performance, com foco na conversão de vendas, considerando a jornada híbrida dos clientes (on e offline).

Principais tarefas:

  • Coletar e processar dados de diferentes fontes (Data Lake, Google Cloud, Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, Sales Force, etc) e realizar análises estatísticas e exploratórias em grandes conjuntos de dados para identificar padrões, tendências e insights relevantes.
  • Criar, treinar e otimizar modelos preditivos de machine learning e algoritmos para prever comportamentos futuros e auxiliar na tomada de decisões estratégicas.
  • Desenvolver dashboards, gráficos e relatórios claros para comunicar os resultados das análises para stakeholders, facilitando a compreensão dos insights extraídos.
  • Garantir a qualidade dos dados, realizando processos de tratamento, normalização e transformação dos dados brutos.
  • Trabalhar em conjunto com outros departamentos, como marketing, digitalização, TI e vendas, para compreender as necessidades do negócio e propor soluções baseadas em dados.
  • Acompanhar as novas tecnologias, ferramentas e técnicas na área de ciência de dados para aplicar melhores práticas no trabalho.


Requisitos e qualificações

Requisitos:

  • Formação superior completa em Ciência de Dados, Estatística, Matemática, Engenharia, Computação ou áreas correlatas.
  • Inglês intermediário / avançado.
  • Conhecimento em linguagens como Python, R, SQL e uso de bibliotecas de machine learning.
  • Capacidade de aplicar conceitos estatísticos para a análise de dados e criação de modelos.
  • Uso de ferramentas como Tableau/Power BI para a criação de visualizações de dados.
  • Capacidade de abordar problemas complexos de forma lógica e propor soluções baseadas em dados.
  • Desenvolvimento e validação de modelos, incluindo regressão, classificação, clustering, entre outros.
  • Habilidade de explicar conceitos técnicos de forma compreensível para pessoas sem formação técnica.


Desejável:

  • Vivência comprovada em funções similares.


Informações adicionais

Trata-se de uma oportunidade CLT, no formato híbrido, com presença necessária em nossos escritórios, nos bairros do Jabaquara e Morumbi, ou em Agências de Publicidade em SP, ou ainda, em São Bernardo do Campo, 3 vezes por semana.

Title: Cientista de Dados Especialista I
HTML:
Job Description

O que faz a área Ciência de Dados na Porto?

A área é responsável por prover tecnologia, dados e inteligência com foco em otimizar a geração de negócios e experiência digital de clientes e potenciais clientes Porto. Dentre as atividades temos como foco:

  • Ativar Dados Comportamentais: de clientes e corretores nos principais canais digitais da companhia através de um ecossistema MarTech, integrado aos demais Produtos de Dados do ecossistema Porto
  • Otimizar a Experiência: dos usuários dos principais Canais Digitais da companhia por meio de Engenharia de Análises quantitativas, qualitativas e Inteligência aplicada, humana e/ou artificial.
  • Aumentar Receita: sendo direcionador da estratégia visão cliente da Porto, impulsionando os principais indicadores de Performance dos Produtos de Negócio na companhia.


Responsibilities and assignments

  • Responsável por apoiar à alavancar os resultados através de estudos e deep dives nos indicadores do negócio, além de apoiar em iniciativas que ajudem no crescimento da maturidade analítica dentro da Porto;
  • Construção de análises para suportar estratégias dos canais digitais através de insights;
  • Desenvolvimento de dashboards de gestão e acompanhamento de indicadores;
  • Apoio na execução de rotinas de analíticas com foco em crescer na maturidade analítica dos canais;
  • Confecção de apresentações para fóruns de acompanhamento de resultados.


Requirements And Qualifications

  • Formação superior completa;
  • Pós graduação na área de Dados (desejável);
  • Conhecimento em google analytics (desejável);
  • Conhecimento avançando em manipulação de dados com SQL/Python;
  • Construção de apresentações de estudos analíticos;
  • Desenvolvimento de dashboards em ferramentas de viz como Looker, Power Bi e/ou Tableau;
  • Saber traduzir desafios de negócio e ter visão analítica;
  • Capacidade de condução de temas e alinhamento com stakeholders;
  • Visão de dono nos temas que atuar.


Additional information

Benefícios

Vale Alimentação e Refeição: Seu VR e VA são flexíveis, para que você atenda às suas necessidades e defina a melhor maneira de utilizá-los;

Vale-Transporte: Para nos encontrarmos na Porto;

Serviços de Transporte: Para o seu conforto e segurança no trajeto até o nosso escritório, disponibilizamos vans nas principais estações de acesso à Porto: Luz, Barra Funda, Santa Cecília e Júlio Prestes;

Plano de Saúde, Odontológico e Seguro de Vida: Para que você possa se cuidar, e também cuidar de seus dependentes;

Participação nos Lucros - PLR: Pois sabemos que só vamos crescer, se crescermos juntos;

Porto em Ação: Programa complementar à PLR, disponibilizando anualmente, até 2025, uma porcentagem de valor do seu salário em ações da Porto;

Pais, mães e filhos: Auxílio creche ou babá, para cuidar do seu bem mais precioso;

Previdência Privada - PortoPrev: Para você garantir um futuro mais tranquilo;

Gympass: Para você possa se exercitar e cuidar da sua saúde física em diversas academias, onde estiver;

Bolsa de estudos; Para você começar uma graduação ou que sonha em fazer uma segunda faculdade ou pós-graduação.

Cursos de Idiomas: Subsídio para cursos de Inglês e Espanhol;

Programa Saúde Integral: Série de benefícios e iniciativas para te apoiar a encontrar equilíbrio de forma integral, através de três pilares: saúde mental, saúde física e saúde financeira;

Desconto em Produtos e Serviços: Para que você possa desfrutar dos produtos e serviços deste nosso ecossistema gigante;

Local de trabalho: Centro de São Paulo

Modelo de Trabalho: Presencial (4x1)

Process stages

  • Step 1: Registration1Registration
  • Step 2: Triagem2Triagem
  • Step 3: Teste/Case3Teste/Case
  • Step 4: Entrevista RH4Entrevista RH
  • Step 5: Entrevista Gestor(a)5Entrevista Gestor(a)
  • Step 6: Hiring6Hiring


Na Porto, Você Importa!

A Porto é muito mais que uma seguradora: é um ecossistema gigante que utiliza tecnologia para criar soluções, através de quatro verticais de negócio: Porto Bank, Porto Saúde, Porto Seguro e Porto Serviço. A reputação e o reconhecimento conquistados ao longo de mais de 7 décadas reforçam o tamanho da Porto, uma empresa referência em negócios, feita para e por pessoas.

Aqui, bate no peito de 13 mil colaboradores o orgulho de fazer parte de uma organização sólida e ética, que transforma sonhos em realidades fantásticas para os nossos mais de 15,8 milhões de clientes. São mais de 101 sucursais e escritórios regionais em todo o Brasil.

O aprendizado faz parte do nosso DNA, e aqui, você terá incentivos, ferramentas e gente boa para você aprender e crescer, a cada dia, um ambiente de acolhimento e segurança, onde cada um possa ser e se orgulhar de quem se é, promovendo um espaço de respeito e vivendo de forma integral e com bem-estar, em uma empresa genuinamente humana.

DIVERSIDADE & INCLUSÃO NA PORTO

Aqui na Porto, valorizamos a diversidade e acreditamos que um time plural é imprescindível para o desenvolvimento de todo o nosso negócio, da sociedade, e de cada pessoa, pois entendemos que cada indivíduo é único na construção de um ambiente mais inovador e inclusivo. Juntos, trabalhamos diariamente para construirmos um espaço seguro, livre e acolhedor, com mais pluralidade e respeito. Por isso, incentivamos fortemente a inscrição de mulheres, de pessoas negras e indígenas, de pessoas com deficiência e de pessoas LGBTQIA+ em todas as nossas vagas.

Title: Data Science Junior
HTML:
ATENÇÃO!

Para essa vaga, o modelo de trabalho é híbrido, sendo necessário ter fácil acesso para atuar em nosso escritório que está localizado em Barueri/SP.

Funções que serão desempenhadas:

  • Criação de variáveis preditoras para o desenvolvimento de modelos de machine learning entre outros desafios de análise preditiva;
  • Busca constante por melhoria nos processos e inovações em relação a ciência de dados.

Requisitos necessários:

  • Ensino superior em cursos como Matemática, Engenharias ou cursos correlatos;
  • Conhecimento básico em SQL e Python;
  • Facilidade para atuar com manipulação e análise de dados;
  • Boa comunicação e habilidades de trabalho em equipe
  • Conhecimento ciclo de crédito (diferencial);
  • Inglês Avançado (diferencial).
